title: Coordinador de Procura de Proyectos
description:
Descripción de la empresa

Anglo American, en sociedad con la Corporación Mitsubishi, está desarrollando la operación minera Quellaveco, uno de los yacimientos de cobre más grandes del mundo, localizado en la región de Moquegua, al sur del Perú.

Quellaveco tendrá una vida de reservas de 30 años. Utilizará proceso minero de tajo abierto y flotación para producir concentrados de cobre, así como molibdeno y plata como subproductos. Se espera que Quellaveco produzca en promedio 300 mil toneladas de cobre por año en sus primeros 10 años de operación.

En Anglo American nuestra estrategia es asegurar y desarrollar Quellaveco aplicando prácticas y tecnologías innovadoras que confiamos a nuestra gente.  Estamos comprometidos a convertirnos en socios para el futuro, operar con seguridad, sustentabilidad y responsabilidad.
 

Descripción del empleo

En Anglo American nos encontramos en búsqueda de un Coordinador de Procura de Proyectos para ser responsable de la Gestión Comercial para Suministros y Contratos de Proyectos Quellaveco, agregar valor a la Compañía mediante optimizaciones y ahorro de costos en la Gestión de Proyectos.

 

TAREAS Y RESPONSABILIDADES CLAVE DEL PUESTO:

  • Responsable de la Contratación de Suministros y Contratos para Proyectos SIB y Operacionales de Quellaveco.
  • Supervisa el Plan Commercial Planning anual para su área.
  • Genera KPI y realiza seguimiento Desempeño de ahorros, cumplimiento de tiempos acordados de SLA con usuarios para el proceso de contratación y la firma de contratos, monitorea entrega a tiempo de los suministros y supervisa la activación de los mismos.
  • Proporciona supervisión y asesoramiento técnico de Contratación de Obras para Proyectos  que se requiera y contribuye al desarrollo de los estándares de la unidad de negocio.
  • Apoya a línea operativa para optimizar el proceso e identifica las iniciativas de mejora en la contratación.
  • Proporciona soluciones integrales en reclamos de proveedores y/o contratistas.
  • Participa en auditorías de revisiones entre colegas y en la confección de parámetros de referencia a fin de garantizar el cumplimiento de los estándares y las especificaciones de la contratación de obras y compra de suministros para proyectos.
  • Monitorea los vencimientos de los Contratos y activa las respectivas modificaciones anticipandamente con su equipo de trabajo.
  • Monitorea los cambios a los contratos (Notas de Cambio) para efecto de anticiparse a aumento de vigencias, montos y anticiparse a reclamos de contratistas.
  • Ofrece supervisión y garantía de los estándares, los procedimientos y las políticas de la Unidad de Negocios.
  • Velar por el cumplimiento de los procedimientos de contratación de la Compañía y procedimientos de Reparados.

Requisitos

CALIFICACIONES

  • Profesional de Ingeniería Comercial, Ingeniería Industrial, Ingeniería Civil, Ingeniería de Sistemas, Ingeniería de Minas o carreras de Ingeniería relacionadas.
  • Deseable con postgrado en finanzas, MBA o maestría en Supply Chain.
  • Preferible con diplomado (conocimientos) de Six Sigma, Lean Six Sigma, mejora continua, Gestión de Proyectos.
  • Nivel avanzado en uso de programas computacionales (Excel, base de datos, PowerBI).

EXPERIENCIA

  • Al menos 10 años de experiencia en procesos de contratación de grandes proyectos en minería, responsable de licitaciones, negociaciones y elaboración robusta de distintos contratos de proyectos (EPC, EPCM, entre otros) tanto con proveedores locales como extranjeros. Negociaciones de
  • Deseable experiencia liderando equipos de personas.

CONOCIMIENTOS

  • Inglés avanzado (indispensable)
  • Conocimiento en herramientas de planificación.
  • Conocimiento de SAP Ariba y SAP AOP (contratación, compras)
  • Conocimiento de legislación local aplicable en contratos.
  • Conocimiento de normas y estándares de seguridad aplicable a su rango de acción.
  • Gestión de Contratos, Compras y Logística para Proyectos.
  • Conocimiento financiero y de rendimientos para análisis de casos de negocio.
  • Enfoque Sistémico.
  • Enfoque de valor compartido y responsabilidad social empresarial.
  • Conocimiento de mejores prácticas y cadena de valor de Supply Chain.

Información adicional

Nuestra empresa son las personas y no tenemos dudas sobre nuestra principal prioridad: hacer todo lo que podamos para mantener la seguridad y el bienestar de nuestros trabajadores. No hay una respuesta fácil, pero al liderar con seguridad e invertir en salud y bienestar, nos estamos acercando más cerca que nunca a nuestro objetivo de Cero Daño.

De continuar a la siguiente etapa, recibirá un correo por parte de nosotros invitándolo a completar su primera evaluación en nuestra plataforma HireVue y un formulario de datos en Ms Forms. Agradeceremos estar muy atento a su bandeja de entrada o de  correo no deseados, a fin de continuar con cada una de  las etapas de nuestro proceso dentro de los tiempos establecidos.

¡Contamos contigo para cumplir nuestro propósito: Re-imaginar la minería para mejorar la vida de las personas!

title: Principal Quality Assurance
description:
Company Description

We’re re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives. That includes the lives of everyone who works for Anglo American. We strive to be a great company where employees are happy, inspired to do their best work. A place where every colleague can grow, develop and realise their potential. To live up to our Always with Purpose employee value proposition, we’re putting the development and growth of colleagues first by ensuring everyone at Anglo American has the career experience they deserve.

Job Description

The purpose of the role is to be the overarching expert and owner for Quality Assurance within Engineering & Maintenance responsible for defining the  quality requirements for Anglo American technical and operational functions, and the development, rollout and implementation  of an appropriate Quality Management strategy, and associated systems, procedures and processes across Anglo American, utilizing industry best practice, strategic and functional experience, and an understanding of the criticality of quality in the mining industry.

  • Identify and define the Quality Assurance requirements for Anglo American.
  • Develop, implement and manage the Anglo American Quality Assurance Strategy.
  • Develop,  implement and manage the Anglo American Quality Management System and associated, systems, procedures, processes and tools.
  • Develop, implement and manage Anglo American Quality Standards and Best Practice Principles.
  • Establish a robust quality assurance program to ensure compliance with applicable standards and regulations.
  • Develop and implement quality control procedures and protocols for all stages of asset procurement, installation, and operation.
  • Conduct regular inspections and audits to verify adherence to quality standards and identify areas for improvement.
  • Collaborate with suppliers and contractors to ensure quality standards are met throughout the E&M supply chain.
  • Implement a Group program regular inspections of OEM facilities and deliverables.
  • Identify requirements, develop, implement  and manage a document control system to manage and maintain quality-related documentation.
  • Provide training and certification programs for employees to enhance their understanding of quality requirements and best practices.
  • Implement a system globally to ensure that quality checks are performed on incoming equipment, assets and materials to ensure they meet specified requirements.
  • Identify, contract and manage quality 3rd parties.
  • Support global Anglo American Business Units in development, entrenchment and management of operation specific Quality strategies, Quality Management Systems, procedures, processes and tools.
  • Conduct operational satisfaction surveys to gather feedback and improve quality processes.
  • Implement continuous improvement initiatives to enhance overall quality performance.
  • Develop a culture of quality awareness and accountability throughout the organization.

Qualifications

  • An undergraduate qualification (Bachelors / Honours degree or equivalent) in a relevant technical discipline.
  • A postgraduate qualification Quality Assurance.
  • A postgraduate qualification (Masters / Doctoral degree or equivalent) in an Engineering discipline would be an advantage.
  • Engineering Registration (PrEng)  would be an advantage.
  • Minimum 10 years’ experience in Quality Assurance.

Technical Experience

  • Experience in development, implementation and management of Quality Management strategies and Quality Management Systems
  • Experience in development, implementation and management of Quality Management procedures, processes, and tools.
  • Experience in Quality Assurance and Quality Management in the mining, heavy industry, manufacturing, or engineering industries.
  • Experience in ISO9000 quality standards.
  • Experience implementing Quality Assurance practices and processes to ensure quality in design, manufacture, supply, logistics, and operational environments.
  • Experience working with suppliers and supply chain to incorporate Quality Assurance standards into supply chain and logistics processes.
  • Experience reviewing Quality Assurance practices at operational sites.
  • Solve technical and operational issues in cooperation with relevant internal stakeholders and external suppliers, implementing the most effective solutions to drive effective outcomes.

Additional Information

Who we are:

We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies. As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

 

Advert Closing date: 03 April 2024

title: Asesor Comercial
description:
Descripción de la empresa

Anglo American, en sociedad con la Corporación Mitsubishi, está desarrollando la operación minera Quellaveco, uno de los yacimientos de cobre más grandes del mundo, localizado en la región de Moquegua, al sur del Perú.

Quellaveco tendrá una vida de reservas de 30 años. Utilizará proceso minero de tajo abierto y flotación para producir concentrados de cobre, así como molibdeno y plata como subproductos. Se espera que Quellaveco produzca en promedio 300 mil toneladas de cobre por año en sus primeros 10 años de operación.

En Anglo American nuestra estrategia es asegurar y desarrollar Quellaveco aplicando prácticas y tecnologías innovadoras que confiamos a nuestra gente.  Estamos comprometidos a convertirnos en socios para el futuro, operar con seguridad, sustentabilidad y responsabilidad.

Descripción del empleo

En Anglo American nos encontramos en búsqueda de un Asesor Comercial

El propósito de Anglo American es re imaginar la minería para mejorar la vida de las personas y se compromete a crear una Mina Viva que aporte un valor positivo a las personas y al medio ambiente donde operamos.

Supply Chain se está posicionando para el futuro, volviéndose más orientada al objetivo para así, ayudar a realizar el propósito de Anglo American e impulsando a ser más ágil y resiliente.  Para ser más orientados al propósito, es fundamental lograr un impacto significativamente más positivo dentro de nuestras comunidades anfitrionas, actuando como canal de comunicación de proveedores para proporcionar velocidad a nuestro programa de innovación, programa de cambio técnico y sostenible, que incluye un mejor rendimiento de seguridad y la incorporación de los principios de la economía circular, así como la entrega general de un valor significativamente más sostenible.  Para construir una cadena de abastecimiento más ágil y resiliente, la ejecución de productos básicos y la digitalización de los procesos es un enfoque clave mientras se impulsa la excelencia operativa.

El equipo de categoría regional es responsable de la gestión integral de todas las actividades de aprovisionamiento estratégico-regional dentro de cobre, incluida la gestión regional de categorías, el abastecimiento y los contratos de las operaciones de Chile y Perú.   El equipo trabaja con las partes interesadas del negocio regional y de la cadena de suministro para implementar y gestionar el rendimiento de los contratos y proveedores, hacer crecer la base de suministro de la comunidad anfitriona y garantizar el suministro efectivo de bienes y servicios necesarios para las operaciones.

PROPOSITO:

Proporcionar actividades comerciales eficientes y eficaces en relación con las categorías regionales que ofrezcan un mejor rendimiento empresarial a través de acuerdos comerciales, búsqueda de ahorros, la innovación, la asociación con proveedores y la colaboración de las partes interesadas internas.

TAREAS CLAVES

Seguridad, salud y medio ambiente

  • Identificar formas de apoyar oportunidades y riesgos específicos de seguridad, salud y sostenibilidad y
  • Garantizar que las actividades de compra transaccionales cumplan con todos los requisitos de seguridad, salud y medio ambiente.
  • Garantizar el funcionamiento seguro del entorno comercial, realizando evaluaciones periódicas de los riesgos y planteando inmediatamente cualquier riesgo o problema
  • Cumplir con las políticas y normas pertinentes y, en particular, con la política y los procedimientos de gestión del rendimiento de los contratistas, a fin de lograr un rendimiento de la seguridad de los contratistas de alto nivel.

Entrega y Rendimiento

General

  • Adoptar una cadena de abastecimiento ágil siendo adaptable y flexible para acomodar y centrarse en las prioridades emergentes y cambiantes de los profesionales del sector. 

Entrega de valor comercial y asociación con proveedores

  • Apoyar el desarrollo de estrategias y planes de categoría, abastecimiento y contratación mediante la recopilación y el análisis de datos y ejecutar responsablemente las actividades de abastecimiento y contratación asignadas.
  • Mantener las relaciones con los proveedores estratégicos, para impulsar un cambio de valor y ofrecer soluciones innovadoras que posicionen a Anglo American como un socio de elección
  • Optimizar el valor a través de la innovación, la mitigación de riesgos y el crecimiento a lo largo del ciclo de vida de la relación.
  • Seguir un conjunto de normas globales-regionales para proveedores y contratistas que permitan la entrega de una manera segura y socialmente aceptable y garantizar que la organización se abastezca de proveedores responsables.
  • Apoyar la implementación de estrategias comerciales para apoyar las necesidades del negocio y mejorar la entrega de valor (ahorros).
  • Responsable de las negociaciones y la finalización de los Acuerdos contractuales.
  • Adherirse a las estrategias de creación de valor y compromiso con los proveedores que se alinean con la estrategia de la cadena de suministro, las tareas críticas, los objetivos de rendimiento y las prioridades de la unidad de negocio.

Planificación

  • Realizar un seguimiento activo de los KPI del cuadro de mando comercial (por ejemplo, tiempos de ciclo,cobertura del contrato, categoría/proveedor/rendimiento de la categoría/proveedor/contratista, etc.) y abordar y escalar los problemas de forma proactiva.
  • Apoyar el desarrollo de estrategias de categoría mediante el análisis y la recopilación de datos.
  • Identificar, habilitar y hacer un seguimiento de las oportunidades de compra inclusiva y de valor, de las iniciativas comerciales y de las necesidades específicas de recursos.
  • Planificar y ejecutar las actividades comerciales pertinentes.
  • Ejecutar las actividades de adquisición de operación y categorías pertinentes de manera oportuna y visible.
  • Seguir y supervisar el seguimiento de los progresos en relación con los objetivos de abastecimiento y contratos y de gestión de categorías.  
  • Aportar información sobre el presupuesto y las necesidades de recursos pertinentes. 

Gestión de compras y contratos

  •  
  • Responsable de la recopilación y ejecución de los eventos de abastecimiento asignados, la contratación y la gestión de contratos (incluida la administración comercial), la gestión del rendimiento de los proveedores/contratos y la gestión de las iniciativas.
  •  
  • Apoyar la ejecución eficaz de las tareas administrativas de los contratos, como los expedientes de precios, las variaciones y las modificaciones.
  •  
  • Implementar planes de entrega de valor para actividades rutinarias y tácticas de abastecimiento y contratación y gestión de contratistas.

Gestión de las partes interesadas y de los proveedores

  • Adoptar nuevas formas de trabajo y uso de sistemas dentro del equipo en relación con los proveedores y las partes interesadas clave. 
  • Apoyar al socio comercial correspondiente en el seguimiento y la actualización del rendimiento de los proveedores, sobre la base de los KPI contractuales. 
  • Identificar las oportunidades de digitalización con los proveedores para desarrollar casos comerciales convincentes y colaborar con las partes interesadas y el Centro de Excelencia de SC para la posible implementación.

Gestión de contratistas

  • Incluir las especificaciones de seguridad y los indicadores clave de rendimiento correctos en la documentación de abastecimiento y de los contratos  
  • Apoyar el desarrollo de los cuadros de mando de los proveedores, la supervisión del rendimiento de los proveedores, la interpretación de interpretación de los datos de rendimiento y desarrollo de ideas  
  • Supervisar el rendimiento comercial de los proveedores, escalar los problemas e impulsar su resolución  
  • Participar en las reuniones trimestrales de revisión/desempeño  
  • Cumplir los plazos previstos para las actividades de gestión de contratos
  • Apoyar las interacciones de los equipos funcionales con las partes interesadas internas para ejecutar las actividades de gestión de la categoría

Excelencia en la cadena de suministro

  • Adoptar nuevas formas de trabajo y uso de sistemas dentro del equipo en relación con los proveedores y las partes interesadas clave. 
  • Apoyar a los gestores de la cadena de abastecimiento y a la función de representante de la empresa en la aplicación y puesta en marcha de los contratos activos.
  • Identificar oportunidades para mejorar las formas de trabajo y mejorar la ejecución de los productos básicos.

Personas y equipos

  • Adoptar una cultura de diversidad e inclusión en el equipo de la cadena de abastecimiento 
  • Cumplir los plazos previstos para las actividades comerciales
  • Apoyar las interacciones de los equipos funcionales con las partes interesadas internas
  • Impulsar la gestión del rendimiento y el aprendizaje personal

Gobernanza y cumplimiento

  • Cumplir con las normas, el sistema designado, la gobernanza y los requisitos éticos y legales.
  • Llevar a cabo actividades en cumplimiento de los requisitos internos de Anglo American y de la cadena de abastecimiento para todos los miembros del equipo y en relación con todas las actividades de contratación y abastecimiento.

Requisitos

Calificaciones:

  • Profesional universitario en carreras afines a la gestión comercial.

Experiencia:

  • 5-10 años de experiencia práctica en el campo correspondiente y en equipos comerciales de Supply Chain ya sea en la industria minera como relacionadas.
  • En procesos comerciales de planta, transporte y logística.

Deseable:

  • Postgrado en una disciplina pertinente y un historial probado de amplia experiencia práctica en una función y un contexto de complejidad similar

Conocimientos técnicos:

  • Buenos conocimientos técnicos en toda la cadena de valor de SC
  • Manejo de SAP (Indispensable) 
  • Capacidad para integrar las subdisciplinas del Área Comercial, PSC, Gestión de Proveedores y Compras
  • Seguridad y sostenibilidad en relación con la cadena de abastecimiento y la contratación inclusiva
  • Fuerte desarrollo de casos comerciales y de negocios
  • Negociación y cierre.
  • Gestión de las relaciones con los proveedores
  • Capacidad de pensamiento crítico y sistémico
  • Ingles nivel medio-avanzado (altamente deseable)

Información adicional

No hay una respuesta fácil, pero al liderar con seguridad e invertir en salud y bienestar, nos estamos acercando más cerca que nunca a nuestro objetivo de Cero Daño.

title: Assistant Logistics Officer
description:
Company Description

As the world leader in marine diamond recovery, we take pride in employing cutting-edge technology and exceptional people skills. Debmarine Namibia offers exciting careers in a performance-driven culture that contributes meaningfully to the company's overall success.

Debmarine Namibia requires the services of a Logistics Officer: Oranjemund Loge Base. The incumbent will be responsible to co-ordinate the aviation Logistics services at the remote Logistics Base in Oranjemund.

Job Description

KEY COMPETENCIES OF THE LOGISTICS OFFICER POSITION ARE:

  • Coordinates arriving passengers and visitors, for further transfers to their final destination e.g. Oranjemund Town, vessels, Windhoek and Cape Town and assist with relevant required permits.
  • Plans crew change process and helicopter movements considering crew change fixed wing flights, arrival times and all other additional requirements bearing in mind other activities taking place at Log Base.
  • Anticipates helicopter movement delays and liaise with the Helicopter Operator for extra/ late flights without compromising safety.
  • Manages unpredictable circumstances in an independent and unsupervised manner whilst adhering to the company policies and procedures.
  • Runs the daily errands, maintenance, and coordinate accommodation bookings, meal tickets and transport to and from town, etc. in a cost-effective manner.
  • Controls and maintains the use of Logistics vehicles and enforce adherence to DBMN and Anglo-American safety standards, policies and procedures.
  • Keeps proper records and logbooks of the people's daily, weekly and monthly movements to and from the vessels.

THE FOLLOWING COMPETENCIES ARE KEY TO THIS POSITION:

  • Liaison and interpersonal skills at all levels
  • Must be self-motivator and able to work without supervision.
  • Planning and organising skills
  • Problem solving skills
  • People Management

Qualifications

DO YOU MEET THE FOLLOWING EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS?

  • Certificate/Diploma in Logistics and Travel Management
  • Grade 12 pass and a valid Driver's license
  • Medical Fitness for a Public Driving Permit is essential
  • 3 years’ experience in an administrative environment preferably experience in a travel environment.

Additional Information

Preference will be given to Namibian citizens and designated persons as prescribed by the Namibian Affirmative Action Act.

WOMEN AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and shall be subjected to further assessment and screening.   

CLOSING DATE: 04 APRIL 2024

title: CHPP Maintenance Coordinator
description:
Company Description

Lead from the front with us!

Anglo American Steelmaking Coal
Steelmaking coal is an essential ingredient in blast-furnace steel manufacture, producing steel used for critical building and infrastructure around the world.  In Australia, we operate five steelmaking coal mines in Queensland’s Bowen Basin, and have additional joint venture interests in steelmaking coal and manganese, as well as copper exploration projects underway in North West Queensland and Western Australia.

Job Description

Reporting to the CHPP Maintenance Superintendent, your core responsibility will be leading your team to deliver maintenance targets whilst maintaining zero-harm. You will be accountable for ensuring all breakdown, shutdown and major overhaul works are responded to and resourced appropriately. This includes facilitating and assisting in investigations for equipment related failures and the coordination of remedial actions. The successful candidate will have high standards with a lead by example approach, excellent organization skills and an ability to manage conflicting priorities to meet deadlines. Strong communication, an ability to liaise with a range of stakeholders and competency in the use of Microsoft programs will also be required.

Previous SAP experience will also be highly regarded.

Qualifications

  • Relevant Mechanical trade qualification or engineering degree
  • MEM qualification or willingness to gain
  • Strong technical aptitude, preferably working in a CHPP with fixed plant equipment
  • Strong leadership abilities to manage expectations of stakeholders at all levels, to ensure consistent planning for production and maintenance strategies
  • Drive for continuous improvement to support high performance and quality standards

Additional Information

  • This is a Monday to Friday role, based in Moranbah
  • Anglo American supports flexible working arrangements, like a 9 day fortnight.
  • Company provided FIFO
  • Subsidised accommodation options and relocation assistance to Moranbah

What we Offer
When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Who we are
We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity, and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies.  As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

Background checks
Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

Inclusion and Diversity
At Anglo American, we embrace change and promote an inclusive and diverse environment where you can bring your whole self to work, every day. We are adopting new approaches to recruitment, talent development, mentoring, parental leave, and flexible working to further support diversity across our business.

How we are committed to your safety
Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Employee referral
Do you know someone who would fit this role? Employee referrals will be accepted for this job. Refer to your local Referral Guidelines for policy conditions and amounts.    

How to apply
To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

REF55981H

CLOSING DATE 
4th April 2024

Please note, screening and interviews may take place prior to closing date – applications may also close before this date.

Recruitment Agencies
Anglo American Steelmaking Coal does not accept unsolicited applications from Recruitment Agencies.

title: CHPP Production Supervisor
description:
Company Description

Anglo American Steelmaking Coal
Steelmaking coal is an essential ingredient in blast-furnace steel manufacture, producing steel used for critical building and infrastructure around the world.  In Australia, we operate five steelmaking coal mines in Queensland’s Bowen Basin, and have additional joint venture interests in steelmaking coal and manganese, as well as copper exploration projects underway in North West Queensland and Western Australia.

Job Description

CHPP Production Supervisor – Moranbah North Mine

Reporting to the CHPP Production Superintendent, you will be responsible for supervising the production crew to safely execute the shift production plans and deliver the annual coal production plan by optimising activities and continually improving the performance of the Coal Handling Processing Plant.

Your core function will be to manage the real time performance of your production crew, deliver against agreed targets and schedules, while ensuring that jobs are completed in a safe and efficient manner. This will involve significant interaction with maintenance personnel and where required, supervision of maintenance activities. As the key production interface at the CHPP, you will be accountable for but not limited to proactively leading and coordinating production crew performance, breakdown response action planning and contingency planning direction, alignment of best practice across crews and ensuring statutory compliance is met.

Qualifications

You will ideally possess:

  • Trade and/or suitable qualifications in line with coal processing.
  • S123 & G2.
  • Significant experience within a coal processing plant environment.
  • Previous experience in leadership roles.
  • Understanding and proven capabilities in driving opportunities for continuous improvement.
  • Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills with an ability to influence and achieve stakeholder buy in.
  • Excellent communication skills with an ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the organisation
  • Understanding of the coal mining process and relevant mining legislation will be highly regarded.

Additional Information

 

  • 8 on 6 off roster
  • Full-time, permanent position.
  • Competitive salary package and annual incentive programs
  • 12% superannuation
  • Residential, DIDO & FIFO (Company Funded) options

title: Environmental Technician
description:
Company Description

Be part of the team. The team that makes it happen.

We are the world’s leading diamond company, powered by thousands of people around the world who are driven to support thriving local communities, protect the natural environment, and stand with women and girls, focused on Building Forever.

If you like chasing demanding targets, thrive on making decisions in the pursuit of brilliance, and enjoy the support of the world’s finest experts, we have a place for you.

Job Description

The Environmental department has an exciting opportunity for 1-year, full-time contract Environmental Technician. This position will be instrumental in the collection, monitoring, analysis and reporting of environmental data at the Gahcho Kué mine site.  Also critical to this position is the communication of departmental objectives and initiatives to site personnel.  The successful candidate will be a self-starter with the ability to troubleshoot problems and be capable of working independently and as part of the team.  The ideal candidate is one who is committed to safe work practices and strives for zero harm.

Key responsibilities:

  • Collect and prepare environmental samples according to regulatory requirements and following site quality assurance standards
  • Field work in a remote sub-arctic environment which may  include heavy lifting
  • Support and promote environmental compliance site wide
  • Review and maintain department specific operating procedures
  • Maintain appropriate records and databases with a focus on continual improvement
  • Collect detailed field notes and draft memos, letters and reports as required
  • Assist in the coordination of waste management, wildlife management and spill prevention programs

Reporting to the Environmental Coordinator, the role is based within the Safety, Health, Environment, Risk and Training department.   This is a site- based position working a 14 day in and 14 day out rotation.   

Qualifications

Formal qualifications:

  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in the field of Environmental Science, Management or Monitoring or equivalent;
  • Minimum two (2) years of experience in either a lab or field setting sampling analysis of water, air and soils;
  • Experience or familiarity with Federal and Provincial legislation with particular focus towards resource development permitting process;
  • Experience with environmental sampling, monitoring and reporting under regulatory mechanisms;
  • Keen to work for extended periods in the outdoors and travel across a tundra environment during all seasons; and
  • Advanced computer skills, particularly in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook);

Desirable Assets:

  • Knowledge of the environment and natural ecology of the Northwest Territories is an asset;
  • Experience in the mining industry with operations at a remote site is an asset; and
  • Experience operating and maintaining equipment (snowmobiles, boats and quads) is an asset.
  • Valid PAL (Possession and Acquisition Firearms Licence)
  • Valid PCOC (Pleasure Craft Operators Card)
  • Experience operating in and around rotary winged aircraft

Additional Information

Who We Are:

Active in Canada for over 60 years, we are part of De Beers Group, the world's leading diamond company. Globally, we are a team of more than 20,000 people, with operations in Canada, Botswana, Namibia, and South Africa, and activities across the diamond value chain from exploration to diamond jewelry retail. Our unwavering focus on sustainability and Building Forever fuels our commitment to advance standards across the diamond industry, protect the natural world, partner with local communities, and accelerate economic inclusion to support diversity in our business and beyond.

In Canada, we have more than 600 employees working at offices in Calgary, Toronto and Yellowknife, actively exploring for new diamond opportunities, recovering diamonds at the joint venture Gahcho Kué mine in the Northwest Territories, and closing and rehabilitating two mines. We are also advancing the Chidliak Project to establish a technologically advanced diamond mine on Baffin Island using FutureSmart Mining™ principles.

At De Beers, we believe in the power of working in partnership with communities to create lasting, positive impacts that endure long after we recover the last diamond. Our inclusive and diverse workplace values mining with respect for the environment and nearby communities, and we seek team players who share our passion for Making Life Brilliant.

Safety

Safety first is a way of life for us. We are unconditional about the safety, health, and the well-being of our colleagues, at work and at home, and about that of the communities where we work. We aim to lead the industry by investing in innovation to protect people, who are at the heart of our business. Our high performing teams take accountability for their own and others' actions, work collaboratively, and always show care and respect.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion (EDI)

As a global #HeForShe Thematic Champion, De Beers is committed to promoting an equitable, inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are. We provide equality of opportunity to enable everyone to fulfil their potential. Please inform us should there be any special requirements that should be considered as part of your application.

Building forever

Sustainability is at the heart of our decision-making – it is how we do business.   Building Forever is key to our purpose as it represents our ambitious and holistic sustainability framework and is central to our ability to deliver long-term value to our communities and partners. This shapes how we protect our social and environmental license to operate, build a long-term legacy in our host communities and earn consumers’ trust in our diamonds that they can wear with pride.

Inclusion & Diversity

We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are. We provide equality of opportunity to enable everyone to fulfil their potential.

Referral

This opportunity is open to a paid referral incentive according to the Employee Referral Policy (HRM.AD.21.00). Referral incentives are applicable to De Beers Group internal employees only.

Background Checks

Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

description:
Company Description

As the world leader in marine diamond recovery, we take pride in employing cutting-edge technology and exceptional people skills. Debmarine Namibia offers exciting careers in a performance-driven culture that contributes meaningfully to the company's overall success.

Debmarine Namibia requires the services of a Storeman. The successful incumbent will co-ordinate the receipt, storage and issuing of materials on the vessel.

  • Computer applications
  • Administrative and problem-solving skills
  • Liaison and interpersonal skills at all levels
  • Planning and organising skills 

Qualifications

DO YOU MEET THE FOLLOWING EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS?

 

  • Grade 12

  • 3 Years relevant experience
  • SAP MM knowledge will be an added advantage

Preference will be given to Namibian citizens and designated persons as prescribed by the Namibian Affirmative Action Act.

WOMEN AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and shall be subjected to further assessment and screening.

description:
Company Description

ou put safety first.  That’s why we want you.

Safe. Smart. Sustainable. Probably not the first words you typically associate with mining. But Anglo American is not your typical mining company.

Guided by our purpose and our values, we enable both high performance and purposeful action as we aim to “re-imagine mining to improve people’s lives', delivering the metals and minerals that make modern life possible – from mobile phones to medicines.

Safety first is a way of life for us.  We are unconditional about the safety, health and well-being of our colleagues, at work and at home, and about that of the communities where we work. Job Description

To provide specialist treasury front office services to Anglo American South Africa’s corporate centre and business units through the strategic analysis and execution of these risks. 

  • Execute financial market dealing for Anglo American and its Southern Africa subsidiaries while ensuring Treasury policy guidelines are adhered to.
  • Provide analysis and co-ordinate treasury front office services relating to cash management, liquidity risk, foreign exchange risk and counterparty risk.  
  • Assist in managing the day to day treasury front office to treasury back office relationship, ensuring robust, efficient and controlled end-to-end processes.
  • Support the process of arranging, negotiating and implementing suitable new and refinanced internal and external loan facility agreements to meet the liquidity requirements of Anglo American and its subsidiaries.

  • Collate and prepare concise reports for use by Group Treasury and other Treasury stakeholders (e.g. cash flow forecast).
  • Negotiate supporting documentation in relation to Treasury activities (e.g. ISDA’s).
  • Monitor counterparty credit risk.
  • Drive change in cash management activities to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Support the negotiation and implementation of guarantee facilities.
  • Assist in providing advice to subsidiaries on suitable investment strategies and the management of external asset managers in relation to rehabilitation fund investments. 

Qualifications

title: Eletromecânico(a) III
description:
Descrição da empresa

Mais do que uma responsabilidade, Segurança é nosso valor. Junte-se a nós nesse compromisso!

Segura. Inteligente. Sustentável. Provavelmente, estas não são as primeiras palavras que você normalmente associa à mineração. Mas a Anglo American não é uma empresa de mineração comum.

Guiados por nosso objetivo e valores, promovemos alto desempenho e ação com foco no propósito de 'Reimaginar a mineração para melhorar a vida das pessoas'. Somos incondicionais diante a segurança, saúde e bem-estar de nossos empregados, seja no trabalho, em casa, e nas comunidades onde trabalhamos.

Nosso objetivo é liderar o setor investindo em inovação para proteger as pessoas, que são o coração de nossos negócios. Nossas equipes assumem a responsabilidade por suas próprias ações e dos demais, trabalham de forma colaborativa e sempre demonstram cuidado e respeito.

Com sede em Londres, Reino Unido, e operações localizadas em todo o mundo, a Anglo American é realmente uma empresa global. Empregamos mais de 60.000 colegas em todo o mundo e gerenciamos operações de mineração na África do Sul, América do Norte e do Sul e Austrália. 

No Brasil, atuamos com dois negócios: Minério de ferro, com Minas-Rio, localizado nos estados de Minas Gerais e Rio de Janeiro; e Níquel, com operações nos municípios de Barro Alto e Niquelândia, em Goiás. Além disso, temos estrutura corporativa localizada em Belo Horizonte.

Estamos buscando talentos que compartilhem nossos valores e nossa crença em um futuro melhor, mais seguro, diverso e respeitoso para a mineração. Você pode ser um deles!

Descrição da vaga

Como Eletromecânico(a) III você será responsável por executar atividades de manutenção eletromecânica em equipamentos de infraestrutura de mina, efetuando serviços de manutenção e apoio a serviços elétricos e de instrumentação.

Veja abaixo as principais atividades:

  • Efetuar inspeção das máquinas e equipamentos elétricos e mecânicos, bem como, identificar defeitos e comunicar as anomalias ao superior imediato.

title: Master Data Finance Analyst
description:
Company Description

Global Shared Services (GSS) is a critical asset for Anglo American and De Beers enabling the delivery of functional service work for Finance & People Services to all Business Unit and Group Functions.

The vision for Global Shared Services (GSS) is to be an exceptional Shared Services organisation, with inspired people, delivering flawless processes, enabled by great technology.

There are three key strategic pillars that GSS is currently aligned to and delivering towards, namely, customers, colleagues and communities.

Proactive and meaningful stakeholder engagement, which includes employees, communication and effective change management are key success factors in the GSS journey.

Job Description

The Master Data Finance Analyst is the custodian of Finance Master Data. They play a key role in Master Data Management process execution in support of the Anglo-American Global Master Data Process. The Master Data Finance Analyst maintains data, analyses data, develops / manages tools to build data standards and continuously improves Master Data quality against those standards.

KEY TASKS

  • Create and maintain finance master data elements in SAP including GL accounts, cost centres, profit centres, etc.
  • Contribute to defining global finance master data standards
  • Ensure the correct master data set up according to master data standards
  • Perform audits and cleansing of existing master data elements to maintain data integrity and quality
  • Perform data quality assessments
  • Check uniqueness and consistency of data
  • Support improvement and process optimisation projects
  • Apply technical knowledge to determine business implications of change requests
  • Define and implement efficient and effective processes for the creation and maintenance for core finance master data objects
  • Document the creation and maintenance of processes in DTPs / Process Flows
  • Ensure smooth operations throughout the product lifecycle by serving as center of expertise for maintaining S/4HANA finance master data attributes according to defined local and global standards
  • Ensure compliance with Group Policies and regulatory requirements (including record management) and continuous improvement of quality relevant processes within finance
  • Facilitation of workshops with operational teams and clients to identify process improvements;
  • Standardising and optimising processes;
  • Determine inefficiencies, propose process-improvement measures and monitor implementation;
  • Work with Operational Managers to identify process issues and risks;
  • Identification and application of best practice to ensure optimal processes.
  • Ensure processes are current;
  • Develop standards, procedures and guidelines for processes;
  • Ensure that all processes and work instructions as defined and approved are uploaded on the portal in collaboration with Functional Learning and or on WPB;
  • Ensure that process changes are affected in accordance with change management principles;
  • Follow a structured process to document process requirement;
  • Maintain the process inventory and supporting documents;
  • Responsible for supporting and enabling the planning and execution on all relevant process roll-outs and process improvements.
  • Demonstrate behaviour in line with health, safety and environmental standards and with the Group’s values;
  • Participate as an effective team member in working collaboratively with your leader, peers and relevant others (including from other teams) to achieve business goals

Qualifications

  • Relevant tertiary qualification or comprehensive experience in a financial discipline (BCOM Accounting /BCOMPT/BCOM(HONS)

EXPERIENCE

  • 1 - 2 years relevant experience
  • Demonstrated functional accounting experience in a similar environment
  • Transactional SAP experience within the SAP FICO module, including master data management
  • Experience performing data audits and quality assessments
  • Experience performing key controls

Additional Information

  • When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Who we are?

  • Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world.

Inclusion and Diversity

  • Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential

How we are committed to your safety

  • Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer

How to apply

  • To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

Descrição da vaga

Como Mecânico(a) II você será responsável por executar as atividades de manutenção mecânica preventiva e corretiva nos equipamentos de infraestrutura de mina, atendendo a programações e solicitações de manutenção.

Veja abaixo as principais atividades:

  • Atender às demandas de manutenção preventivas e corretivas,  com orientação, avaliando o desgaste de peças e componentes mecânicos.

  • Realizar testes e ajustes nas máquinas e equipamentos reparados, com orientação.
  • Preencher a Ordem de Manutenção – OM com informações referentes ao trabalho executado, anotando mão de obra utilizada, materiais e equipamentos utilizados, bem como anotações de necessidades futuras de intervenção.
  • Apoiar no planejamento das atividades de manutenção, avaliando condições de funcionamento e desempenho de componentes de máquinas e equipamentos.
  • Apoiar na lubrificação de máquinas, componentes e ferramentas.
  • Realizar leitura e interpretação de desenhos mecânicos, pneumáticos, hidráulicos utilizando o manual das máquinas.
  • Aplicar o 5S em suas atividades.
  • Cumprir as políticas e procedimentos de Segurança e Saúde Operacional, Meio Ambiente, Responsabilidade Social e Integridade Empresarial.

Qualificações

O perfil que estamos buscando para essa posição:

  • Curso profissionalizante em mecânica.
  • Pacote Office Básico.
  • Desejável CNH B.

  • Garantir a orientação da equipe quanto aos aspectos técnicos dos materiais e procedimentos para manuseio e estocagem, visando manter a integridade, características e condições de uso dos produtos;
  • Organizar e preparar a equipe para realização de inventário físico do estoque de matérias-primas e produtos, para controle, apuração e correção de resultados físicos;
  • Assegurar a motivação da equipe e a melhoria do seu desempenho por meio do acompanhamento do desenvolvimento das atividades, da viabilização de treinamento adequado e do incentivo ao cumprimento dos objetivos;
  • Acompanhar a execução de auditorias, a fim de apresentar as documentações necessárias e tratar as não conformidades;
  • Identificar necessidades de aprimorar e modernizar equipamentos, instalações, visando melhorar a segurança, desempenho e produtividade;
  • Acompanhar a atividade de registro fiscal no ERP reportando as anomalias para as áreas pertinentes;
  • Acompanhar as movimentações e baixas de entrada de estoque e saída de estoque;
  • Monitorar o desempenho das operações de armazéns através de KPIs e análises estatísticas para apoio à gestão nas definições das ações estratégicas.

O perfil que estamos buscando para essa posição:

Descrição da empresa

Mais do que uma responsabilidade, Segurança é nosso valor. Junte-se a nós nesse compromisso!

Segura. Inteligente. Sustentável. Provavelmente, estas não são as primeiras palavras que você normalmente associa à mineração. Mas a Anglo American não é uma empresa de mineração comum.

Nosso objetivo é liderar o setor investindo em inovação para proteger as pessoas, que são o coração de nossos negócios. Nossas equipes assumem a responsabilidade por suas próprias ações e dos demais, trabalham de forma colaborativa e sempre demonstram cuidado e respeito.

Com sede em Londres, Reino Unido, e operações localizadas em todo o mundo, a Anglo American é realmente uma empresa global. Empregamos mais de 60.000 colegas em todo o mundo e gerenciamos operações de mineração na África do Sul, América do Norte e do Sul e Austrália.

Descrição da vaga

Você será responsável por  desenvolver e implementar planos e estratégias de manutenção dos equipamentos industriais afim de assegurar o nível desejado de confiabilidade do processo produtivo no que diz respeito à manutenção. Sua atuação vai abranger as disciplinas de Manutenção Mecânica, Elétrica, Instrumentação e Automação.

Estará no seu escopo realizar análises de falhas com planos de ação acompanhados de avaliação de eficácia, Implementar as práticas de gerenciamento de ativos.

Veja abaixo as principais atividades:

  • Atuar em novos projetos, realizando análise ''RAMS'' (Confiabilidade, Disponibilidade, Mantenabilidade e Segurança)
  • Contrinbuir para os inputs de confiabilidade em novos projetos olhando para as especificações de designs e instalções e criando planos de comissionamento e start up.
  • Participar do desenvolvimento de critérios para a avaliação de fornecedores de equipamentos, sobressalentes e serviços técnicos/consultorias.
  • Desenvolver testes de aceitação e critérios de inspeção para serviços e equipamentos
  • Conduzir o processo de Eliminação de Defeitos no Site
  • Coordenar a análise de criticidade de ativos e suportar o desenvolvimento de táticas de manutenção de ativos levantando e provendo os dados de confiabilidade
  • Facilitar o desenvolvimento de FMEAS durante o processo de desenvolvimento de táticas de manutenção de ativos.
  • Realizar melhoria continua baseado na analise de dados,  estabelecendo o FRACAS (Failure Reporting, Analysis and Corrective Action System) e facilitando RCAs (análises de causa raíz) extensas e complexas
  • Previnir os defeitos na fonte trabalhando em conjunto com a manutenção para estabelecer padrões e especificações técnicas de alinhamentos, balanceamentos, torqueamentos, lubrificação,etc.
  • Analisar os dados de desempenho, manutenção e confiabilidade para identificar oportunidaeds de melhorias em custos, volume de produção e segurança.
  • Realizar benchmarck dos indicadores de performance considerando outras unidades com operações similares no mercado de mineração e siderurgia.
  • Conduzir o processo de integridade estrutural da AA conforme o padrão técnico global em vigencia (GTS) 
  • Suportar a implementação do programa de gerenciamento de ativos da AA, focando nos planos de ações gerados pelas avaliações da área técnica global/corporativa.
  • Realizar estudos de LCC (custo do ciclo de vida ds equipamentos)
  • Revisar e atualizar os planos de manutenção dos equipamentos críticos

Qualificações

O perfil que estamos buscando para essa posição:

  • Ensino Superior Completo em Engenharia Mecanica e Elétrica
  • Desejável MBA / Pós Graduação em Engenharia de Manutenção e Confiabilidade.
  • Experiência em Manutenção Industrial, principalmente em britagem e fornos rotativos, abrangendo a área de engenharia de confiabilidade
  • Inglês avançado ou intermediário para apresentações e facilitação com nossos times globais

*Vaga exclusiva para pessoas que se identifcam como Mulher

Informações adicionais

Por que fazer parte do nosso time?

Somos uma empresa empenhada em fazer nossas crenças e valores acontecerem de verdade. O objetivo é proporcionar a você um ambiente de qualidade, diverso e seguro para que você desenvolva o seu melhor. Para isso, oferecemos os melhores benefícios:

· Para cuidar da sua saúde física e mental:

Gympass, Plano de Saúde e Odontológico (extensivo a você e seus dependentes), além de Assistência Psicológica e Aplicativo Saúde Emocional

· Especial para você e sua família:

 Auxílio Creche, Programa Família, Brinquedo de Natal e Vale Alimentação!

· Espaço para ser você mesmo:

Fique à vontade para participar de nossos Grupos de Afinidades e dos eventos incríveis da Semana da Diversidade!

· Para seu futuro:

Plano de Previdência Privada diferenciado

· E ainda:

Transporte fretado, refeições no local de trabalho, remuneração variável, Seguro de Vida, Apoio e orientação: Jurídico, financeiro, social e psicológico.

Como estamos comprometidos com a sua segurança?

Nada é mais importante para nós do que garantir que você volte para casa com segurança após um dia de trabalho. Para que isso aconteça, temos os padrões de segurança mais rigorosos do setor. Além disso, também estamos investindo continuamente em novas tecnologias, de drones a análise de dados, que estão ajudando a tornar a mineração mais segura.

Inclusão e Diversidade

Temos o compromisso de promover um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e diversificado, no qual valorizamos e respeitamos cada colega por quem ela/ele é. Acolhemos e celebramos todas as identidades de gênero, etnias, idades, espiritualidades, orientações sexuais, deficiências, classes sociais, estilos de vida e habilidades. E foi para escutar todas essas vozes que criamos os Grupos de Afinidades: espaços seguros para discutir, refletir e construir ações de inclusão e diversidade no âmbito da equidade de gênero, LGBTQIAP+, etnia, pessoas com deficiência e geracional.

Nós queremos colegas que se sintam valorizados, respeitados e sintam-se abertos para trazer seu “verdadeiro eu” para o trabalho.

*Reforçamos que todas as vagas estão abertas para pessoas com deficiência (PcD) e reabilitados do INSS.

Nosso processo seletivo

Para se candidatar a essa vaga, realize seu cadastro on-line, e anexe seu currículo no ato da inscrição.

Nosso processo seletivo, de forma geral, é constituído das seguintes etapas: inscrição, análise dos currículos, dinâmica/entrevista, avaliação comportamental, exame médico e admissão.

Fique atento à página da/do candidata/candidato, assim como aos meios de comunicação (e-mail, telefone, WhatsApp), pois todo o processo será mediado por essas plataformas.

Venha com a gente construir o futuro da mineração!

title: Driller Coal Operator
description:
Company Description

Let’s drill down to business, with our unwavering support guiding every mining endeavor. We've got your back.

Anglo American Steelmaking Coal
Steelmaking coal is an essential ingredient in blast-furnace steel manufacture, producing steel used for critical building and infrastructure around the world.  In Australia, we operate five steelmaking coal mines in Queensland’s Bowen Basin, and have additional joint venture interests in steelmaking coal and manganese, as well as copper exploration projects underway in North West Queensland and Western Australia.

Job Description

We are currently seeking experienced Driller Operators to support our mining production teams at Capcoal Surface Operations.

The primary responsibility of the Production Driller role is to operate the production drill rig efficiently and safely, ensuring that production holes are drilled according to geological and survey specifications. This includes rig setups in accordance with design and survey requirements.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Safely and effectively operate Blast Hole Drills to meet production schedules.
  • Maintain a safe work environment by actively participating in safety management practices and processes.
  • Demonstrate a track record of working safely and a commitment to safe working practices.
  • Take accountability for actions and output, with a willingness to learn new skills and work to the best of your ability.
  • Collaborate as part of a team to achieve business objectives.

Qualifications

  • Current C Class Drivers Licence
  • Previous experience with DK25 & D90K
  • Experience on Dozer, grader or dump truck would be an advantage

Additional Information

  • Full-time, permanent positions
  • 7 ON / 7 OFF, Dayshift / Nightshift Rotating Roster
  • Capcoal Surface Operations Enterprise Agreement 2022 (EBA)

  • Location: Capcoal Surface Operations, Middlemount
  • BIBO from Mackay and Rockhampton area
  • FIFO (Sal Sac) CAMP (Company Funded)
  • DIDO, Residential options
  • Middlemount Housing and Assistance (Sal Sac)

What we Offer
When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Who we are
We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity, and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies.  As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

Background checks
Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

Inclusion and Diversity
At Anglo American, we embrace change and promote an inclusive and diverse environment where you can bring your whole self to work, every day. We are adopting new approaches to recruitment, talent development, mentoring, parental leave, and flexible working to further support diversity across our business.

How we are committed to your safety
Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

title: Graduate - Digital
description:
Company Description

Join us in the Anglo American Graduate Programme as a Marketing Business Unit Graduate in the Digital space, if you are ready to take the first step towards a successful career in the mining industry.

Finding and developing our future leaders is something we're passionate about.

In addition to discovering, mining and processing many of the essential raw materials that enable, support and enhance modern life, our global business is involved in selling and marketing products – such as copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal, nickel and diamonds.

Within our Marketing Business, we are able to offer innovative solutions to meet our customers’ specific challenges. This includes physical products, logistics and technical support, as well as pricing and financing solutions.

To achieve this, we count on a passionate group of people with a diverse blend of talents. They are at the heart of everything we do.

Job Description

As a Marketing Business Unit Graduate you will collaborate within the Marketing Digital team within the Digital Hive, utilizing data and analytics to address tangible business challenges in commodity trading.

Play a pivotal role in shaping the Digital Hive's Digital Solution Roadmap for the commodity desks, providing them with data-driven decision support tools to enhance their ability to optimize commercial performance.

Performance & Delivery

  • Develop, enhance, and maintain data analytics models under supervision of Senior Data Scientists. The models include optimization models, predictive models and new technologies in data, AI, machine learning.
  • Collaborate with product owners, developers, data engineers and subject matter experts to design and develop specific digital solutions and products.
  • Explore external industry, research competition, commercial and digital trends that can impact Anglo American including identifying new digital technologies and potential applications and innovative ways of working.
  • Research new external digital practices and technologies, choose the ones that would be beneficial for Anglo American Marketing.
  • Work with the Marketing BU to identify potential value creating digital opportunities.
  • Apply approaches such as Agile, Design Thinking, Improving Customer Experience which are key for the success of Digital Hive

Compliance

  • Adherence to all Anglo American Group and Marketing policies and procedures, as well as observing proper standards of conduct relating to the role.
  • Comply with Anglo American Security and Operating Standards.

Qualifications

  • Master's Degree required in a quantitative related area, e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or Data Science, is preferred. PhD candidates in a similar discipline are also encouraged to apply.
  • Fluent in programming with Python or other similar language.
  • Good understanding of digital technologies such as AI, machine learning and their applications. Understand the results of these models, analyse deviations and propose solutions to refine the models and able to explain in business context.
  • Good knowledge about operations research, statistics, mathematical modelling, machine learning and deep learning.
  • Understanding of commodities covering trading, operations, risk management and financial accounting is a plus.
  • Have completed your degree or are due to graduate by December 2023. 
  • Have no more than two years of relevant work experience.
  • Singapore based candidates are encouraged to apply.

Additional Information

Who We Are
Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world.

As a responsible miner – of diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal and nickel – we are the custodians of what are precious natural resources. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives.

What We Offer
When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

What to Expect

  • The first stage of the recruitment process is a review of your CV.
  • Should you pass the initial screening stage, you will be invited to complete an on-demand video interview and game based psychometric test where we will test your motivations and competencies for the role.
  • The next stage will be a phone interview with one of our Recruiters.

Anglo American Steelmaking Coal
Steelmaking coal is an essential ingredient in blast-furnace steel manufacture, producing steel used for critical building and infrastructure around the world.   In Australia, we operate two open cut and three underground steelmaking coal mines in Queensland’s Bowen Basin, every year producing millions of tonnes of the highest quality hard coking coal for this purpose.

Job Description

We are currently seeking a highly motivated Outbye Operational Coordinator to ensure compliance is maintained within our Moranbah North Mine to Outbye Standards regarding stone dusting, secondary support, roadway maintenance, water management and coal and fines management.

Reporting to the Outbye Superintendent and is primarily responsible for the coordination of all Outbye operational activities including but not limited to the following:

 

  • Maintaining a safe and productive mining environment through regular underground inspections
  • Assisting the operations team to deliver production targets safely, optimally, and in accordance with the annual mine plan.

title: Specialist - Market Analysis (Copper)
description:
Company Description

You’re talented and adaptable. That’s why you’ll fit in.

The purpose of the Marketing BU is to sustainably maximise cash flows from the marketing of Anglo American products and services. In support of this, we have set ourselves a target to deliver a considerable uplift in Value by 2023.

A Market Intelligence (MI) capability has been established within each of the Commodity Marketing Teams, which supports commercial decision-making in each of the Marketing functions and across the wider organisation. The Marketing organisation regards this capability as providing a critical element to its mission to become the most respected marketing function in the industry.

Job Description

What you’ll do

This is a key role in the provision of base metals market intelligence, with a focus on copper, that drives commercial decisions by capturing insights, utilising data and information gathered from the industry or service providers. Analysis and forecasting of industry/sector trends and market outlook, identifying opportunities and threats, with the objective of promoting views and ideas to support the origination, trading and sales teams, executive management in Anglo American Marketing and the wider organisation.

Market Intelligence plays a central role in assessing how to capitalise on commercial opportunities through sound analysis and forecasting of commodity markets and successful interactions with relevant internal and external stakeholders.

 

KEY TASKS

Safety, Health & Environment  

  • We give our all to eliminating injuries because we value life and are unconditional about safety, health and well-being at work and at home.
  • Every Marketing Employee will spend time each quarter working on activity which supports Physical Health and Safety.

 

Performance & Delivery  

  • Delivery of market intelligence to Marketing and Group stakeholders through the process that includes gathering, collating, filtering, analysing, and interpreting market data and intelligence specific to the copper market and related industry. Outcomes are tailored to support directly commercial decision-making and discovery of trading opportunities. An expectation to increasingly display leadership and individual initiative in provision of insights in a pro-active vs reactive manner.
  • Responsible for the daily capture and communication of collective knowledge gathered from the Sales & Marketing Teams as well as other internal and external sources via various channels and portals. At the forefront of ideas generation, challenge and aligning the copper trading team. Putting forward specific trading ideas to action.
  • Responsible for the build out of price and statistical forecasting models to identify arbitrage opportunities on various commercial variables (e.g. copper concentrate treatment terms).
  • Act as a key interface with external market analysts, and data & research providers to uncover intelligence used to advise the Copper Marketing Team. A major focus will relate to Base Metals strategy development and identification of sourcing and origination candidates in a systematic and disciplined process. Generating networks (industry connections, service providers, customers etc.).
  • Conduct monthly and quarterly market analysis used as an input to the quarterly market forecasts, weekly reports, daily internal notes and ad hoc reports and internal studies. Demonstrating independent management of these processes and tasks. Generating topical reports based on personal initiative and observations. Communicating and presenting the results.
  • Support the identification and assessment of third-party trading and sourcing & origination targets. Track and contribute to successful interactions and negotiations.
  • Providing in-depth profiles to assist with customer discovery and strategic initiatives, supplemented by site visits. Involvement in planning and leading visits to gain ‘on the ground’ insights.
  • Attending relevant conferences and industry events. Contributing to industry events.

 

Compliance

  • Adherence to all Anglo American Group and Marketing policies and procedures, as well as observing proper standards of conduct relating to the role.
  • Comply with Anglo American Security and Operating Standards

 

Qualifications

What we’re looking for

  • Knowledge of commodity markets and ability to build an industry network.
  • Able to marry macro-economic context with micro-market analysis to identify the most important drivers of price and commercial variables over short- and medium-term horizons. Knowledge of financial and futures markets a strongly positive element.
  • Knowledge and ability to translate complex market data into succinct reports and presentations.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of current quantitative and qualitative marketing research methodologies, determining which methodologies to apply.
  • Familiarity with broad scanning techniques to interpret trends, research competitor activity and market conditions; develops and implements solutions to realise market potential and optimise opportunities for the Marketing Business Unit.
  • High degree of numerical capability, as required, including ‘technical analysis’. Highly developed modelling capabilities.
  • Strong computer literacy (especially Excel).
  • Confident research skills with an inquisitive and broad scanning approach – able to ask insightful and probing questions to get to the bottom of a situation or problem; doesn’t stop at the first answer.
  • Sound writing capability and willingness to develop strong presentation skills, tailored to the specific needs and requirements of the audience.
  • Commercial and business acumen – ability to build understanding of sales and marketing fundamentals.
  • Experience of developing long term supply and demand models across commodities.
  • Cross commodity and sectoral experience preferred, particularly for base and battery metals such as vehicles sector.
  • Experience presenting insights to senior executives.
  • Comfortable with interpreting macroeconomic trends and translating into value-adding insights for relevant commodities

Additional Information

Who we are

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world.

As a responsible miner – of diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal and nickel – we are the custodians of what are precious natural resources. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives.

What we offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Amazing opportunities for learning and growth - from technical training to leadership programs, we bring out the best in our people
  • We’re a large, successful multinational company and there are plenty of opportunities internally to move onwards and upwards too

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

Covid Vaccination Intent

Since safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines have become widely available this year, we have strongly encouraged employees to get vaccinated at the earliest possible opportunity. However, as vaccines have been proven to be a very effective and safe way of protecting people and reducing Covid-19 transmission, we have now announced our intent to introduce a policy that requires Covid-19 vaccination for access to all sites and offices. This policy would apply to all new joiners to the company as well as existing employees and contractors.

We are in the process of undertaking a comprehensive engagement process with all our stakeholders about our intent. There may be differences in how and when it is implemented due to local context and legal requirements.
