title: Mine Medic (Days & Nights)
description:
Company Description

Anglo American is a leading global mining company, and our products are the essential ingredients in almost every aspect of modern life. Our portfolio of world-class competitive mining operations and undeveloped resources provides the metals and minerals that enable a cleaner, greener, more sustainable world and that meet the fast-growing consumer-driven demands of the world’s developed and maturing economies.

We are constructing a state-of-the-art underground mine to enable the extraction of Polyhalite – a unique multi-nutrient fertiliser – along with the necessary infrastructure both above and below ground that will be required for transport, processing, and distribution.

POLY4 is our flagship multi-nutrient fertiliser product. Made from polyhalite, it contains four of the six macro-nutrients and many micronutrients that are essential to plant growth. It allows farmers to maximise their crop yield, increase quality and improve soil structure with one simple product.

Job Description

Join us as a Mine Medic where you will implement the emergency response associated policies and procedures to ensure alignment with the Anglo American Crop Nutrients Occupational Health Department and Business needs.

Your duties will include;

Emergency Medical Response 

  • Administer first-aid treatment and life-support care to sick or injured persons.
  • Make decisions quickly and have a clear effective communication pathways. 
  • Participate in the development of an integrated approach to the delivery of emergency and urgent care involving all relevant stakeholders. 
  • Perform clinical duties commensurate with national clinical practice guidelines and AACN specific PGD’s and guidelines. 
  • Assess the nature and extent of illness or injury to establish and prioritise medical procedures.
  • Observe, record, and report to senior clinical/physician the patient's condition or injury, the treatment provided, and reactions to drugs and treatment.
  • Administer drugs, orally or by injection, and perform intravenous procedures under a physician's direction.
  • Make reasoned decisions regarding initiating, modifying or ceasing treatment or procedures and ensuring accurate documentation of decisions. Being accountable and responsible for clinical decisions made during the course of duty and seek senior clinical/occupational health physician advice where appropriate. 
  • Immobilise patient for transportation on stretcher for ambulance/aircraft transport, using backboard or other spinal immobilization device. 
  • Responsible as an autonomous practitioner using local care pathways when required. 

Equipment

  • Maintain medical equipment and replenish first-aid equipment and supplies. 
  • Operate/calibrate equipment such as external defibrillators and bag-valve mask resuscitators in advanced life-support environments.

Documentation and Record Keeping

  • Ensure the prompt, legible and accurate completion of all patient and incident records, providing a full and accurate record of decision making in accordance with the Caldicott principles, current legislation and regulatory framework. 
  • Participate in clinical audit and effectiveness processes as required including evaluation of clinical procedures, processes and instructions to ensure the highest standards of service are achieved in the interest of patient care. Where appropriate, make proposals for change to own working practices and policies within own working area. 
  • Complete and submit all necessary reports and notifications as required to Operational project supervisors, Clinical, Health & Safety Dept etc.
  • Adhere to information governance, GPDR and confidentially. 

Medical Surveillance 

  • Carry out medical and health surveillance as scheduled and record findings. Escalate any anomalies. 
  • Participate in the delivery of wellbeing initiatives.

General Responsibilities

  • Work closely and liaise with the Occupational Health Department Staff and Hygiene team members. 
  • Participate in support of the Occupational Hygiene Program.
  • Take responsibility for own health and wellbeing, promoting the ongoing care of physical and mental wellbeing to meet the requirements of the role. 
  • Maintain the security of the department and equipment.
  • Maintain individual scope of practice and professional registration as defined by current HCPC Standards of Proficiency - Paramedics. 

Qualifications

  • Professional registration as defined by current HCPC Standards of Proficiency - Paramedics. 
  • Working knowledge of MS Office suite. 
  • Experience of using IT systems.
  • Experience of working in a busy office / customer care environment.
  • Experience of working in Healthcare/Occupational Health.

Additional Information

Who we are:

We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies. As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

What we Offer:
When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership program’s, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

How we are committed to your safety:

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

It allows farmers to maximise their crop yield, increase quality and improve soil structure with one simple product. 

Job Description

Join us as a Process operator where you will report to the R&D Shift Supervisor, you’ll be based at a purpose-built production and R&D facility within the Wilton International site and will be responsible for the day-to-day operation of a continuous production facility. 

Your duties will include: 

  • Control and maintain a variety of equipment and machinery during normal operation, scheduled maintenance, and emergency repair procedures. 
  • Identify defects, malfunctions, or performance issues and initiate appropriate repair procedures promptly. 
  • Actively participate in all aspects of production, including operating and maintenance planning, quality conformance, and housekeeping.
  • Review maintenance work orders thoroughly before commencing work, ensuring all requirements are met. 
  • Assist in the development and implementation of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for newly installed fixed plant. 
  • Proactively identify and address risks, challenges, and opportunities for safety enhancements and plant improvements. 
  • Inspect mechanical systems and equipment rigorously for damage, malfunctions, and safety hazards, reporting incidents or near misses promptly. 
  • Provide feedback on new training materials and support the training and development of new team members. 
  • Conduct thorough point-of-work risk assessments as part of routine operational activities, prioritising safety at all times.
  • Monitor operational parameters through meters, gauges, and control boards, adjusting according to standard protocols and work instructions. 
  • Ensure all accidents, incidents, near misses, and non-conformances are promptly reported in accordance with Company policies and procedures.
  • Attend and actively contribute to daily/weekly Safety Briefs, ensuring both individual and team adherence to Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) standards. 
  • Utilise various displays to comprehend operational performance variables accurately, recording information meticulously into logs and databases. 
  • Complete preventative maintenance routines and provide input to the maintenance management system to record equipment condition and history.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for newly installed fixed plant. 
  • Proactively identify and address risks, challenges, and opportunities for safety enhancements and plant improvements. 
  • Inspect mechanical systems and equipment rigorously for damage, malfunctions, and safety hazards, reporting incidents or near misses promptly. 
  • Participate actively in team meetings and maintain clear communication with peers, supervisors, and the management team. 

Qualifications

  • NVQ Level 3 HNC in an Engineering Discipline or equivalent.   

Knowledge and experience required:  

  • Significant experience as a mechanical maintenance technician or multi skilled Process Operator within the industrial/manufacturing environment.
  • Demonstrated background in heavy industry and materials handling, showcasing robust mechanical fitting expertise encompassing conveyors, pumps, bearings, couplings, pipework, valves, boilers, and compressors.
  • Experience of HPGRs and granulation equipment would be an advantage. 
  • Prior exposure to health and safety protocols within operational environments, with formal training being a distinct asset. 
  • Proven track record in fault finding and comprehensive plant/equipment servicing, ensuring optimal operational performance.
  • Exceptional communication skills, fostering effective collaboration as a cohesive team member, coupled with a steadfast commitment to continuous learning. 
  • A strong team player with the willingness to learn.
  • A self-starter capable of independent working with minimum supervision. 
  • Hands-on approach to tasks, adept at thriving under pressure and adeptly managing workload prioritisation to meet operational needs. 
  • Proficient in navigating ambiguity inherent in developing systems and procedures, with demonstrated experience contributing to the setup phase of new plant or project initiatives.
  • Competency in operating Forklift Trucks (FLT), performing lifting and slinging operations, utilising Overhead Workshop Cranes, operating MEWPs, and possessing Harness Training certification.

Additional Information

Who we are:  We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies. As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.  

What we Offer: When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programs, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

title: Market Intelligence Analyst, Europe (Role can be based in the UK, France, Germany, Italy Or the Netherlands)
description:
Company Description

Anglo American is a leading global mining company, and our products are the essential ingredients in almost every aspect of modern life. Our portfolio of world-class competitive mining operations and undeveloped resources provides the metals and minerals that enable a cleaner, greener, more sustainable world and that meet the fast-growing consumer-driven demands of the world’s developed and maturing economies. 

We are constructing a state-of-the-art underground mine to enable the extraction of Polyhalite – a unique multi-nutrient fertiliser – along with the necessary infrastructure both above and below ground that will be required for transport, processing, and distribution.  

POLY4 is our flagship multi-nutrient fertiliser product. Made from polyhalite, it contains four of the six macro-nutrients and many micronutrients that are essential to plant growth. It allows farmers to maximise their crop yield, increase quality and improve soil structure with one simple product. 

Job Description

As a Market Intelligence Analyst you will identify the best sources of fertilizer market intelligence relevant to POLY4 and the wider Crop Nutrients business to develop a broad understanding of AACN’s markets, customers and competitors. You will work initially in the Commercial Strategy team though work closely with stakeholders throughout the Solutions and Marketing team to translate information into actionable insight.  

This role is to be be located in the UK, France, Germany, Italy or the Netherlands

Your duties will include: 

  • Identify, analyse and manage a wide network of sources of information / intelligence across fertilizer markets, customers, and competitors
  • Develop a broad network of internal and external sources to capture data and insights
  • Compile and manage a repository of intelligence and data
  • Develop and roll-out processes and tools that allow stakeholders to easily access intelligence and insight
  • Create intelligence reports, forward-looking insights and deep-dive analysis (both ad-hoc and regular) with actionable insight
  • Identify, analyse and manage key customer and competitor intelligence that meaningfully influences strategy and decision-making
  • Uncover market opportunities and evaluate value-capture potential
  • Liaise with regional heads and coordinate and consolidate data and insight
  • Work with regional teams and external agencies to collect requirement, determine scope, and finalise market intelligence project timelines
  • Oversee and profile competing products, in areas such as value proposition, pricing and sales strategies to assist in the product strategy development
  • Work with Product / Marketing Data Analysts on competitive offerings, financials, pricing, and marketing positioning.
  • Ensure all data is captured, stored and managed in accordance with data policies
  • Uphold corporate sustainability and social policies and responsibilities
  • Adhere to people policies and practices
  • Support direct and indirect teams working in a collaborative manner

Qualifications

  • Bachelors (equivalent) within a business or analytical discipline
  • Experience of working within a commercial, strategic and/or consulting function is essential.
  • Experience analyzing and synthesizing qualitative and quantitative data, identifying. implications and observing patterns, drawing conclusions, and explaining facts, data or information from a wide variety of resources.
  • Demonstrable experience of working across multiple, varied projects and handling large volumes of data across different types.
  • Demonstrable understanding of statistical analysis outputs.
  • Knowledge of fertilizer industry preferred but not essential.
  • Advanced experience with a range of data manipulation techniques.
  • Proficient communication to business stakeholders as well as analysts and product leads

title: Control Room Operator
description:
Company Description

Expand possibilities with technology

Anglo American Steelmaking Coal
Steelmaking coal is an essential ingredient in blast-furnace steel manufacture, producing steel used for critical building and infrastructure around the world.  In Australia, we operate five steelmaking coal mines in Queensland’s Bowen Basin, and have additional joint venture interests in steelmaking coal and manganese, as well as copper exploration projects underway in North West Queensland and Western Australia.

Job Description

We are currently seeking Control Room Operators at our Aquila operation in Middlemount, QLD. 

As a Control Room Operator you will play a key role in monitoring the mine environment and communicating changes and actions for safe response. You will be responsible for coordinating all activities on a shift by shift basis with a crew covering seven days per week.

Reporting to the Compliance Superintendent, you will have an intimate knowledge and understanding of the underground coal mining environment, communication systems, emergency response and site safety requirements, and will be able to develop collaborative working relationships across Managers, Superintendents, Process Coordinators, Supervisors and ERZ Controllers.

This role will see you provide accurate information to shift at all times, keep the shift MSO’s aware of any arising issues encountered on shift, as well as any emergency response required to any incident that evolves on shift.

The primary purpose of the Control Room Operator is to manage and control the shift underground communication and monitoring strategies to enable safe and efficient operations to occur.  The position also provides the focal point for communication within the mine from a production and safety perspective.

The Control Room Operator is required to fulfil the duties as required by the relevant Emergency Response duty card; this specifies that the position provides the communication / recording function during a significant incident.

Qualifications

  • Advanced knowledge Safegas, citect/SCADA.
  • Working knowledge of underground coal mining operations
  • Previous experience in a Underground Coal Mine Control Room Operators role
  • Gas chromatograph competency
  • Advanced level of computer literacy, particularly with MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)
  • Exceptional attention to detail and the initiative to follow up on results to ensure accuracy and timeliness of work
  • Proven ability to effectively work within a team environment
  • You will also hold expert knowledge of emergency response and first aid equipment with a strong commitment to health and safety standards
  • Advanced/Senior First Aid Certificate – preferred
  • Experience with Weather Guard, lightning tracker software, Minedash desired but not essential
  • Excellent communication skills are required

Additional Information

  • Full-time permanent, position
  • 7:7 Roster – Rotating
  • Residential, DIDO, FIFO (Company Funded) options available
  • Subsidised accommodation & relocation assistance available

What we Offer
When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies.  As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

*Matrícula ativa em uma instituição de ensino superior nos cursos de Psicologia, Administração, Gestão de Pessoas ou Gestão de RH;

*ComTato e OrientaRH (programas que oferecem suporte jurídico, financeiro, e psicólogico);

*Trilha de Desenvolvimento de Estagiários (treinamentos exclusivos para estagiários com temas como: Autoconhecimento, Gestão de Projetos, Comunicação e muito mais!).

Como estamos comprometidos com a sua segurança?

Nada é mais importante para nós do que garantir que você volte para casa com segurança após um dia de trabalho. Para que isso aconteça, temos os padrões de segurança mais rigorosos do setor. Além disso, também estamos investindo continuamente em novas tecnologias, de drones a análise de dados, que estão ajudando a tornar a mineração mais segura.

Inclusão e Diversidade

Temos o compromisso de promover um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e diversificado, no qual valorizamos e respeitamos cada colega por quem ela/ele é. Acolhemos e celebramos todas as identidades de gênero, etnias, idades, espiritualidades, orientações sexuais, deficiências, classes sociais, estilos de vida e habilidades. E foi para escutar todas essas vozes que criamos os Grupos de Afinidades: espaços seguros para discutir, refletir e construir ações de inclusão e diversidade no âmbito da equidade de gênero, LGBTQIAP+, etnia, pessoas com deficiência e geracional.

Venha fazer parte do nosso time!

title: Coal Clearance Mechanical Maintenance Coordinator
description:
Company Description

Anglo American Steelmaking Coal
Steelmaking coal is an essential ingredient in blast-furnace steel manufacture, producing steel used for critical building and infrastructure around the world.  In Australia, we operate five steelmaking coal mines in Queensland’s Bowen Basin, and have additional joint venture interests in steelmaking coal and manganese, as well as copper exploration projects underway in North West Queensland and Western Australia.

Job Description

As our Coal Clearance Mechanical Maintenance Coordinator, you will be responsible for the coordination of all maintenance activities in the coal clearance conveyor system, mine dewatering, and other underground infrastructure. Your zero harm mindset and personal commitment in initiating, delivering and embedding safety improvements is paramount for the role. You will be able to display through your extensive supervisory experience your ability to lead your team to logically problem solve, and develop and balance short and long term strategies and solutions.

Key accountabilities include, but are not limited to; 

  • Develop a high performance culture within the crews through strong leadership including appropriate communication, delegation, coaching and managing performance.
  • Develop and implement maintenance execution plans in the relevant CMMS and scheduling software packages to deliver effective maintenance in accordance with maintenance strategy requirements.
  • Implement maintenance improvement initiatives to optimise maintenance execution, maintenance strategies machine performance.
  • Ensure all incidents are reported, investigated and mitigated promptly and are conducted at a high standard
  • Collect and review machinery performance data and evaluate KPIs to develop performance improvement and corrective action plans
  • Report deficiencies and implement plans to address deficiencies
  • Conduct continual safety audits to check that all safety requirements are being met
  • Demonstrate compliance to legislation by immediately rectifying all issues found during inspections or making safe and arranging for rectification as soon as possible
  • Identify specific risks within working area and adhere to plans to avoid these risks

Qualifications

  • Relevant Trade Qualification or a Diploma or Degree in Engineering
  • Current RIIIS301 – Apply Risk Management Processes (S1)
  • Current RIIOHS301 – Conduct Safety and Health Investigations (S2)
  • Current RIICOM301 – Communicate Information (S3)
  • Current RIIRIS402 – Carry out Risk Management Process (G2)

Additional Information

  • 7 on, 7 off roster
  • Full-time, permanent position.
  • Competitive salary package and annual incentive programs
  • Residential, DIDO & FIFO (Company Funded) options
  • Subsidised accommodation & relocation assistance available

What we Offer
When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Who we are
We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity, and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies.  As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

Background checks
Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

Inclusion and Diversity
At Anglo American, we embrace change and promote an inclusive and diverse environment where you can bring your whole self to work, every day. We are adopting new approaches to recruitment, talent development, mentoring, parental leave, and flexible working to further support diversity across our business.

How we are committed to your safety
Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Employee referral
Do you know someone who would fit this role? Employee referrals will be accepted for this job. Refer to your local Referral Guidelines for policy conditions and amounts.    

How to apply
To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

REF55794T

CLOSING DATE 
14th April 2024

Please note, screening and interviews may take place prior to closing date – applications may also close before this date.

Recruitment Agencies
Anglo American Steelmaking Coal does not accept unsolicited applications from Recruitment Agencies.

title: Financial Controls and Compliance Specialist
description:
Company Description

We’re re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives. That includes the lives of everyone who works for Anglo American. We strive to be a great company where employees are happy, inspired to do their best work. A place where every colleague can grow, develop and realise their potential. To live up to our Always with Purpose employee value proposition, we’re putting the development and growth of colleagues first by ensuring everyone at Anglo American has the career experience they deserve.

Job Description

The Financial Controls and Compliance Specialist will be positioned to the Anglo American Group (including the Corporate Business) to assist in meeting global and local compliance requirements for internal controls over financial reporting (ICFR).

title: Specialist - Credit Risk (Commodities)
description:
Company Description

Join us as a Specialist - Credit Risk. You’re talented and adaptable. That’s why you’ll fit in.

As well as discovering, mining and processing many of the essential raw materials that enable, support and enhance modern life, our global business is involved in selling and marketing products – copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal, nickel and other commodities. Through our Marketing Business, we are able to offer innovative solutions to meet our customers’ specific challenges. This includes physical products, logistics and technical support, as well as pricing, financing and risk management solutions.

Job Description

The Credit Risk Specialist is responsible for assessment and monitoring of credit exposure for all counterparties within the assigned portfolio, as well as provide solutions and value-add to the business by engaging in due diligence discussions and giving guidance on credit policy and risk appetite. It is a critical and highly visible role with accountability towards managing credit and counterparty risk across Marketing’s multi-billion dollar global portfolio spread across multiple countries, industry sectors, counterparts with risks originating from both physical as well as financial transactions. 

In this role, you will cover a portfolio of counterparties within EMEA or the America and actively communicate with the various commodity sales and trading desks to fully understand the risk nature of the transactions requiring analysis and approval. You will use your analytical and technical skills to develop an independent and informed view of the counterparty’s and the transaction’s risk profile.

The Credit Risk Specialist will contribute beyond day-to-day credit risk management, including credit portfolio reporting, deep dive analysis, contribution to policy improvements, projects and system initiatives. The role holder will exercise judgement to balance achieving an appropriate risk and reward return for the business, engage strongly with stakeholders and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver key business initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Leadership

  • Be a point of contact for the European Front Office teams regarding all credit risk inputs and transactions.
  • Lead meetings and discussions independently with the stakeholders to drive the required outcomes on all credit risk matters, with assistance and support from your line manager as needed.
  • Support in development guiding junior members of the team, contributing to a strong and supportive team environment.
  • Keep abreast of industry best practices and apply those to identify improvement opportunities regarding policy, process and procedures.

Credit Analysis and Advisory

  • End-to-end ownership of the assigned commodity portfolio by completing credit reviews in a timely manner and ensuring zero backlog.
  • Prepare credit reviews for new and existing counterparts that highlight current and potential risks in a clear and succinct manner and make clear recommendations to mitigate the identified risks.
  • Conduct proactive research, analyze financial statements, and evaluate all available qualitative and quantitative information on counterparties to determine internal ratings and appropriate credit limits to ensure exposure remains within Marketing’s internal risk appetite.
  • Engage with Front Office teams on early-stage potential transactions to communicate credit views and challenges on commercial proposals.
  • Structure appropriate credit protections (primarily credit insurance and discounting) by engaging with Front Office teams, with a view to optimize risk versus reward.
  • Work actively with counterparts, Group Legal and other internal stakeholders in negotiating credit terms and credit support instruments as part of the documentation process for sales & purchase contracts and master trading agreements, including ISDA/CSA.
  • Assist with relevant data requests and credit risk insights across the business to ensure accurate data and robust insight feed into other parts of the business.
  • You will have a delegated authority to make decisions on credit limits.

Portfolio Monitoring and Reporting

title: Principal - Architect (Finance)
description:
Company Description

You’re talented and adaptable. That’s why you’ll fit in.

As well as discovering, mining and processing many of the essential raw materials that enable, support and enhance modern life, our global business is involved in selling and marketing products – copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal, nickel and diamonds. Through our Marketing Business, we are able to offer innovative solutions to meet our customers’ specific challenges. This includes physical products, logistics and technical support, as well as pricing and financing solutions.

The purpose of Marketing Information Management (IM) is to enable the delivery of business processes, compliance, controls and decision support through the deployment, support and maintenance of Marketing wide front, middle and back office technology applications and infrastructure.

Job Description

Marketing IM requires an experienced Enterprise Architect with strong technical skills in SAP, Quantum and other finance solutions, Microsoft Stack technologies and Azure services with experience of Finance, Tax and Treasury to join our team. The role holder will play a critical role in setting the technology strategy, roadmap, and design-direction for software systems for the finance solutions. They will be trusted advisors and innovation partners to the Marketing business and combine expert knowledge in Microsoft technologies with their commodity trading value chain experience to harness technology in support of delivering safe, secure, resilient solutions to enable the Marketing business.

KEY TASKS

Performance & Delivery

  • Responsible for the overall architecture related to the Finance solutions.
  • Develop enterprise-wide architecture strategy and design future-ready ecosystems that meet the strategic requirements of the business.
  • Be a trusted advisor to a range of stakeholders. Provide consultancy and influence senior leadership teams. Facilitate decisions ensuring the agreed solution balances functional fit, cost, service quality and systems management requirements at a high level. Drive out adoption of new technology and re-use of existing technology decisions as appropriate.
  • Key contributor to the wider Marketing IM Architecture strategy and roadmap, that meets the requirements of the business. Facilitating development of enterprise-wide solutions that include business and technology capabilities and defining and communicating the current and future state architecture for a business portfolio including roadmaps and technology investment prioritization. 
  • Provide architectural leadership to multi-disciplinary teams and drive architecture workshops, review boards, and collaboration sessions.
  • Provide consultancy in the start-up phase of projects to ensure high-level solution assurance as well as providing high-level design assurance throughout project delivery.
  • Understand production plan, identify, and manage project design dependencies and design decisions, and provide support for identifying resource expertise based on solution complexity and design.
  • Review and challenge the high-level cost of proposed solutions ensuring cost covers all aspects of technical elements, infrastructure, work breakdown and resource cost.
  • Effectively engage and manage key stakeholder relationships collaboratively within the architecture community and the wider capabilities of Marketing IM, Group IM, Digital, third party vendors, and within relevant business areas.
  • Modernize the Marketing architecture, leveraging the latest trends in the technology, including determining the right platforms and architecture with scalability consideration.

Thought leadership & Innovation:

  • Responsible for capturing, prioritizing, incubating, and exploiting market and environmental trends to the benefit of Marketing, working in collaboration with colleagues from the business, Digital, BI and Group IM.
  • Proactive contributor to the Architecture Community of Practice, encouraging innovation amongst the community and supporting individuals and teams to share creative ideas and learn from failures.
  • Ambassador for innovation, with the ability to connect relevant technology advancements with opportunity for business strategy execution.

Quality & Controls:

  • Defining and implementing architectural quality controls, standards, and practices to ensure compliance and cohesion between business and technology strategy and Marketing transformation activities.
  • Responsibility for defining and maintaining best-practice, high value, architecture artefacts.

Qualifications

Role-specific knowledge:

  • In depth Functional and Technical expertise in Finance solutions
  • Proven experience working in a commodities/financial environment in strategic IT roles at senior technical level
  • Experience of SAP and other third party products implementations involving multiple entities
  • Deeper understanding of the Finance and performance reporting, tax and treasury management process.
  • Expert in using enterprise solution architecture tools and techniques
  • Expert of architecture governance and design assurance processes
  • Experience of Commodities value chain (Trade Lifecycle), Contract to cash
  • Knowledge of Physical and Financial markets in mining or commodities industry.
  • A proven track record of delivering business value from technology by aiding clients to develop and govern their enterprise architecture
  • Deeper understanding and knowledge of digital trends in commodities Finance space
  • Strong working knowledge of the latest digital and emerging technology solutions and how these can be leveraged to business advantage.
  • Proven experience of project and programme delivery methodologies (Agile, Waterfall etc)
  • Demonstrated understanding of architecture deliverables through the project life cycle based on complexity and timeline of projects/programmes
  • Experience of working in a multi-vendor and supplier environment, maximising value delivered from Marketing IM’s investment in Microsoft services
  • Good stakeholder engagement and influencing skills with colleagues, partners / vendors & project sponsors
  • Experience of developing enterprise architectures in large corporate environments, including strategy formulation, roadmap development and target architectures
  • The ability to negotiate complex issues and how to reach a consensus with key stakeholders through an understanding of modern technologies
  • Demonstrate experience in participating in large scale software development projects, providing advice, guidance and architectural services into engineering teams and programme delivery teams

Development and Technology:

  • SAP (FM, Ariba, AFC),FIS Quantum, Anaplan, Blackline
  • Experience with various structure and unstructured data solutions
  • Deep understanding and experience of creating cloud based microservices architecture with Azure/AWS cloud
  • Experience working in an Agile development environment
  • Deep understanding of Azure DevOps
  • Experience designing analytics solutions driving insights from large data sets
  • Strong experience of business driven and test-driven development

Additional Information

Who We Are

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world.

As a responsible miner – of diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal and nickel – we are the custodians of what are precious natural resources. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Amazing opportunities for learning and growth - from technical training to leadership programs, we bring out the best in our people
  • We’re a large, successful multinational company and there are plenty of opportunities internally to move onwards and upwards too

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

How To Apply

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

title: Multi-skilled Operator
description:
Company Description

Dawson are seeking Multi-Skilled Operators to join our high performing production teams!

Rear Dump, Track Dozer and Grader/Loader

Anglo American Steelmaking Coal

Steelmaking coal is an essential ingredient in blast-furnace steel manufacture, producing steel used for critical building and infrastructure around the world.  In Australia, we operate five steelmaking coal mines in Queensland’s Bowen Basin, and have additional joint venture interests in steelmaking coal and manganese, as well as copper exploration projects underway in North West Queensland and Western Australia.

Job Description

We are currently seeking Multi-Skilled Operators to assist our mining production teams at our Dawson Mine.

The successful applicants will be able to demonstrate a record of working safely and a commitment to safe working practices. You will be accountable for your actions and output and also display a willingness to learn new skills and to work to the best of your ability. Along with a commitment to working together as part of a team to achieve business objectives and the ability to work shift work.

Qualifications

To be successful in this role you will ensure compliance with all Anglo American safety and operating systems and a commitment to working together as part of a team to achieve business objectives. You will need to possess relevant experience in large open cut mining operations. Dawson Mine is seeking candidates with experience in the below:

  • Rear Dump
  • Track Dozer
  • Grader / Loader

In return for your commitment, we offer very competitive salary and training and career development opportunities. 

Additional Information

  • Dawson Collective Enterprise Agreement 2021 
  • 7 on 7 off Day / Night Roster
  • Residential and DIDO Options (FIFO Salary Sacrifice)
  • Subsidised Housing or Camp accommodation available

 

What we Offer

When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Who we are

We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity, and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies.  As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

Background checks

Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

Inclusion and Diversity

At Anglo American, we embrace change and promote an inclusive and diverse environment where you can bring your whole self to work, every day. We are adopting new approaches to recruitment, talent development, mentoring, parental leave, and flexible working to further support diversity across our business.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

How to apply

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

#REF55390N     

CLOSING DATE 
16 MAY 2024

Please note, screening and interviews may take place prior to closing date – applications may also close before this date.

Recruitment Agencies

Anglo American Steelmaking Coal does not accept unsolicited applications from Recruitment Agencies.

title: Operador Tranque ES
description:
Descripción de la empresa

Anglo American es una compañía minera líder a nivel mundial. Nuestros productos son los ingredientes esenciales de casi todos los aspectos de la vida moderna. Nuestra competitiva cartera de operaciones de clase mundial y recursos por desarrollar, proporcionan los metales y minerales que posibilitan un mundo más limpio, ecológico y sustentable, y satisfacen las crecientes demandas de consumo de las economías desarrolladas y en desarrollo del mundo. 

Con nuestra gente en el corazón de nuestro negocio, aplicamos prácticas innovadoras y las más recientes tecnologías para descubrir nuevos recursos; extraer, procesar, transportar y comercializar nuestros productos a clientes en todo el mundo, de manera segura, responsable y sustentable.

Como una compañía minera responsable —de diamantes (por intermedio de De Beers), cobre, metales del grupo del platino, mineral de hierro, carbón y níquel— somos los custodios de valiosos recursos naturales. Trabajamos junto a nuestros socios de negocios y diversos grupos de interés para liberar el valor sustentable que esos recursos representan, tanto para nuestros accionistas, comunidades y los países donde operamos, como para la sociedad en su conjunto. 

Anglo American está re-imaginando la minería para mejorar la vida de las personas.

Descripción del empleo

El propósito del rol es el de garantizar la correcta y segura depositación de arena en el muro para cumplir con los estándares y diseños geométricos y de calidad de este.

Algunas de las principales tareas del rol son: 

- Depositar las arenas provenientes de la clasificación en el muro del Tranque.

- Ayudar en la operación de equipos críticos (Bombas, Válvulas y otros).

- Operar o manejar las descargas de los nudos de depositación, tanto de arenas como de lamas (Instalar pitutos).

- Velar por el correcto funcionamiento de las diferentes áreas que componentes el Tranque.

- Cautelar la correcta alimentación de aguas hacia la Planta.

- Apoyar en el desembarque de tuberías.

- Establecer un trabajo coordinado con los demás operadores y áreas asociadas.

- Procurar la limpieza y orden del lugar del trabajo para desempeñar una labor segura.

- Verificar el cumplimiento de estándares y procedimientos en terreno, así como normalizar los desvíos detectados. 

- Cumplir y hacer cumplir el Reglamento Interno y las políticas de seguridad, salud ocupacional y medio ambiente.

- Conocer y aplicar los procedimientos de seguridad y evaluar y controlar los riesgos asociados a las tareas del cargo.

-Ejecutar rutina de vigilancia por turno para asegurar no tener desviaciones.

- Cumplir con el programa de depositación de arenas en el muro, garantizando su correcta colocación.

- Cumplir con las actividades relacionadas al Programa de Control de Riesgos (PCR).

Requisitos

Calificaciones Formales

  • Enseñanza Media Completa
  • Título Técnico Universitario en Matalurgia o Minería deseable
  • Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en Minería
  • 1 año de experiencia en Tranque deseable

Otros Requisitos

  • Disponibilidad para trabajar en sistema de turnos 4x4 día/noche en nuestra Operación de El Soldado. 
  • Residencia en comunas aledañas a la Operación de El Soldado.
  • Licencia Conducir B.
  • Salud compatible con trabajo en Operaciones Mineras.

Información adicional

En Anglo American estamos comprometidos a promover un entorno inclusivo y diverso, en el cual se valora y respeta a todos los colegas por ser quiénes son, y donde todo el mundo tiene la oportunidad de desplegar su potencial.

  • Nuestros principales habilitadores son:
  • Líderes inclusivos que valoran la diversidad y los aportes únicos de cada colega.
  • Lugar de trabajo flexible, integrador y solidario.
  • Colegas sean valorados y respetados, que se sientan seguros de traer todo su ser al trabajo
  • Entorno seguro, efectivo y propicio para todos nuestros grupos de interés.

Por esto, todas nuestras vacantes están disponibles para todos quienes cumplan con la descripción del cargo. Somos una empresa inclusiva y queremos que seas parte de ella. La diversidad en género, LGBT+, edad, cultura/religión, etnia o condición de discapacidad (Ley 21.015) es bienvenida.

title: Operador Despacho Ácido Fundición Chagres
description:
Descripción de la empresa

Anglo American es una compañía minera líder a nivel mundial. Nuestros productos son los ingredientes esenciales de casi todos los aspectos de la vida moderna. Nuestra competitiva cartera de operaciones de clase mundial y recursos por desarrollar, proporcionan los metales y minerales que posibilitan un mundo más limpio, ecológico y sustentable, y satisfacen las crecientes demandas de consumo de las economías desarrolladas y en desarrollo del mundo. 

Con nuestra gente en el corazón de nuestro negocio, aplicamos prácticas innovadoras y las más recientes tecnologías para descubrir nuevos recursos; extraer, procesar, transportar y comercializar nuestros productos a clientes en todo el mundo, de manera segura, responsable y sustentable.

Como una compañía minera responsable —de diamantes (por intermedio de De Beers), cobre, metales del grupo del platino, mineral de hierro, carbón y níquel— somos los custodios de valiosos recursos naturales. Anglo American está re-imaginando la minería para mejorar la vida de las personas.

Sistema de turno: 4x4 mixto

 

Descripción del empleo

Propósito

Realizar labores de almacenamiento y despacho de ácido sulfúrico concentrado en camiones a diferentes clientes según programa semanal, gestionando la distribución del producto de acuerdo a los resultados de certificación de ácidos coordinando con el área de logística y operaciones.

Responsabilidades del cargo

  • Responsabilidad de realizar las tareas de acuerdo a procedimientos establecidos por la campañía.
  • Responsabilidad de denunciar cualquier incidente personal o material ocurrido durante el desarrollo de esta tarea.
  • Responsabilidad de mantener el área aseada y ordenada.
  • Participar en la ejecución del Programa de Control de Riesgo (PCR), chequeando y revisando la aplicación de herramientas preventivas como procedimientos, normas e instructivos asociados a su proceso, colaborando activamente en la identificación de oportunidades de mejora a través del levantamiento de reporte de peligros y desvíos, inspecciones y observaciones conductuales dentro de su grupo de trabajo, entre otras y participando en el desarrollo y aplicación de las herramientas de gestión de riesgos operacionales ART y DET
  • Verificar periódicamente condición operativa de medios de transporte de producto, chequeando que este cumpla con la normativa de transporte de sustancias peligrosas.
  • Revisar los controles de seguridad asociados al área de trabajo (diphoterine, emergencia ducha de alarmas, entre otros), verificando que se encuentren bajo estándar, según procedimiento de la empresa.
  • Realizar inspección de las instalaciones, visualizando fallas, requerimientos de mantención y condiciones inseguras, reportando al operador consola.

Tareas Claves

 

  • Realizar control diario de stock ácido disponible para despacho, verificando en los estanques la disponibilidad y calidad según programa, de acuerdo a requerimientos y procedimientos de la empresa.
  • Habilitar las válvulas correspondientes al estanque de ácido producto a cargar, de acuerdo con las especificaciones del cliente.
  • Ejecutar carga de ácidos desde puente de carguío a estanques de camiones controlando parámetros operacionales en terreno, de acuerdo a procedimiento.
  • Reportar al turno entrante y al operador consola, los despachos de ácido que se generaron durante su turno, detallando el movimiento de despachos de ácido.
  • Realizar muestreo al ácido producto para enviar a empresa certificadora externa.
  • Realizar inspecciones a los camiones y estanques de ácido grado “A” y circuito de cañerías, estanques y equipos.
  • Participar en la tarea de entrega de equipos, verificando energía cero para los requerimientos de mantención, (drenaje de líneas, vaciado de pozo, etc.)
  • Coordinar y apoyar labores de mantención del área de acuerdo con las asignaciones de su jefatura.

 

 

Requisitos

  • Titulado de Técnico Nivel Medio o Superior en Minería, Metalurgia, Químico
  • Experiencia deseable en procesos químicos o metalúrgicos

Conocimientos

  • Deseable, procesos de ácido sulfúrico o sustancias químicas.
  • Normas ISO 14.001, OHSAS 45.001.

En Anglo American estamos comprometidos a promover un entorno inclusivo y diverso, en el cual se valora y respeta a todos los colegas por ser quiénes son, y donde todo el mundo tiene la oportunidad de desplegar su potencial.

  • Líderes inclusivos que valoran la diversidad y los aportes únicos de cada colega.
  • Lugar de trabajo flexible, integrador y solidario.
  • Colegas sean valorados y respetados, que se sientan seguros de traer todo su ser al trabajo
  • Entorno seguro, efectivo y propicio para todos nuestros grupos de interés.

Por esto, todas nuestras vacantes están disponibles para todos quienes cumplan con la descripción del cargo. Somos una empresa inclusiva y queremos que seas parte de ella. La diversidad en género, LGBT+, edad, cultura/religión, etnia o condición de discapacidad (Ley 21.015) es bienvenida.

title: Manager Mining
description:
Company Description

We have an exciting position for a Manager Mining who will lead the Load and Haul Mining function teams at our Mogalakwena Mine to deliver safe, productive outcomes in-line with agreed plans, operating standards and legal requirements.

By looking after our assets, you’ll become an asset too.

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world.
Our Platinum business mines, processes, and refines the entire range of platinum group metals (PGMs): platinum, palladium, rhodium, ruthenium, iridium, and osmium. We are the world’s leading primary producer of PGMs, which have a range of specialized applications that improve lives across the world – from vehicle fuel cells to jewelry; dentistry to glassmaking; pacemakers to petroleum refining. 

Job Description

Mogalakwena is a TIER1 global asset with one of the best resources in world. 

Mogalakwena recently commissioned the worlds biggest rope shovel and is equipped with world class mining equipment. Significant operational improvements are required to achieve the company’s ambition of being the most valued mining company.

This includes realization of our efficiency and cost improvement program, Zero Harm, Elimination of Fatalities, and advancement of Future Smart Mining. Our values and the Anglo American Operating Model support the delivery of these outcomes by making it clear that how we deliver results is inextricably linked to what we deliver.

Key deliverables in this role are as follows :

Safety and Health

  • Lead company operational risk management process in the department 
  • Oversee consistent application of Safety & Health principles in all discipline interactions and take personal responsibility for safety of self and others to ensure zero harm and elimination of fatalities
    • Act as a role model and reinforce a workplace culture where safety and health for the site is paramount
    • Provide an environment for on-site discipline to challenge and act on unsafe behaviours without repercussions
    • Consider safety and health impacts for communities in close proximity in decision-making within discipline
  • Develop discipline-specific plans/systems to reduce exposure to discipline-specific risks
    • Design and approve operational risk management systems to assess critical risks and monitor effectiveness of critical controls within the discipline
    • Identify PUEs and monitor critical control performance within discipline
    • Ensure teams under management embed critical controls into daily work practices
  • Monitor and ensure effectiveness of discipline Safety & Health systems

Performance & Delivery

Business Expectations

  • Meet operational business expections in Business plan
  • Provide Mining-specific input to the development of the Life of Asset Plan and the Resource Development Plan
  • Break down Group requirements and performance targets to site level, translate into site-specific targets and budgets and communicate to on-site teams
  • Develop implementation program for group best practice principals

Operational Planning

  • Provide Mining input into site-specific 5-year plan, lead development and ongoing management of the site Mining BP(5 year)
  • Drive continuous improvement of on-site Mining work and cross-functional interfaces required to deliver safe, sustainable and efficient operations
  • Ensure there is an agreed plan in place to deliver improvements to benchmark on all priority Mining equipment within 3 years

Work Management

  • Effectively lead and manage Mining operations to deliver the budget including all relevant production, safely, environmental, cost and quality targets
    • Manage process and costs to ensure the Mining teams set and deliver the annual budget and production targets safely, efficiently and cost effectively
    • Develop cost awareness within Mining discipline and focus on reducing all process waste
    • Work closely, collaborate proactively and resolve issues jointly with Processing to align tonnage to fragmentation/volume/grade targets and with AS&R to align equipment availability targets, fixed plan infrastructure operational reliability programs
    • Embed systems, targets and processes to effectively track and control execution on a monthly basis, ensuring a high level of compliance to plan across suite of metrics
    • Apply work management principles and processes of AAOM to ensure appropriately detailed operational and execution planning over multiple time horizons
    • Optimise the Dispatch Fleet Management System (and mine management systems) to ensure efficient mining operations in line with plans and the delivery of benchmark performance on priority equipment
    • Review mining equipment fleet selection and equipment performance, considering maintenance/operational performance outcomes and installed system capability/capacity
    • Ensure availability of available or planned fleet (equipment) to deliver challenging mine plans and schedules
  • Provide thought leadership to all mining activities to ensure a realistic range of options are investigated, considered and effectively implemented, with recognition of effective discipline integration and value from synergies

Feedback

  • Identify and embed business initiatives and improvement projects into site operational processes to support delivery of best practice mining performance 
  • Proactively identify Mining-related challenges and opportunities that new systems, equipment and technology could address
  • Embed new technologies into the on-site Mining work once solution design is execution-ready

Sustainability & Social

  • Manage delivery of the sustainability activities as relevant to the discipline and set out in the Life of Asset Plan to improve sustainability performance over time
  • Implement and participate in processes that build relationships with key local stakeholders
    • Participate in site-level local engagement forums as relevant to discipline
    • Ensure any engagements with stakeholders are consistent with long-term BU and Group sustainability initiatives and standards

People & Teams

  • Create a purpose-led, high-performing culture within the discipline that is aligned with the company values, is inclusive and promotes diversity
  • Lead effective employee & contractor management processes for the discipline
    • Ensure individuals and teams have the authorities and resources (time, people and budget) to perform their tasks in line with the nature/complexity of work and industry benchmarks on efficiency
  • Drive people development within discipline
  • Engage in local dispute resolution with employee representative bodies as relevant to discipline, escalate as required

Compliance

  • Lead compliance of the discipline with external (legislative, regulatory, permitting) local requirements as a minimum level of site performance
  • Ensure compliance with Anglo American requirements within discipline on site
  • Develop required compliance governance for the discipline
  • Oversee investigation of incidents (safety, health, environmental and social) occurring within the discipline

This role is at a Band 5 level reporting to the Senior General Manager

Qualifications

  • Relevant tertiary qualifications preferably with a Bachelor of Mining Engineering, or post graduate Mining Master’s degree
  • Legislatively required qualifications (e.g. 'Ticket', country-specific) minimum 10 years experience.
  • Minimum 10 years experience in holding statutory management position (or demonstrated ability to do so)
  • Completed line Supervision and Superintendents roles, with full operational accountability through the business cycle

Technical Knowledge:

  • Operations:
    • Dispatch functions
    • In-depth knowledge of load and haul key value drivers across site value chain and interdependence of key levers
    • Principles and elements of the Operating Model focussing on Work Management and its implications on the discipline
    • Project management fundamentals
    • New technologies and their impact on operational activities within scope of role
    • Business improvement tools and techniques
    • Extraction and drill & blastas well as Load and Haul optimisation
    • Contamination management and grade control
  • Commercial:
    • Commercial/business drivers in discipline, business performance variability and underlying causes that define subsequent actions
    • Basic financial metrics, cost and value management & budgeting tools
  • Management:
    • Risk management techniques and critical controls
    • Value chain management within discipline, and awareness of interdependencies across value chain steps
    • Leadership tools for creating a culture of purpose–led high performance and change
    • AA organisation model concepts and principles
  • Compliance:
    • Safety, health and environment, legislative, statutory, regulatory and permitting requirements

Technical Skills:

  • Operations:
    • Development and application of solutions to the discipline value chain to ensure productive and safe work and achieve plans
    • Application of Sustainability and Safety concepts to decision-making
    • Business improvement techniques to improve business performance and sustainability for the discipline
    • Interpretation of benchmarks, identification of performance gaps and development of targeted, effective plans to achieve measurable improvements for the discipline
    • Allocation and management of work packages across a portfolio of project activities
    • Leading and managing through crises and times of transformation and change
    • Core mining processes including extraction, material movement, grade management, dispatch and load/fleet management
  • Commercial:
    • Identification and rapid capitalisation on business and operational opportunities
    • Commercial and business thinking to decision making to generate value
    • Business case development, quantifying value and addressing stakeholder requirements
    • Contracts management for discipline (e.g., supplier management, contract compliance, setting and managing delegated authority and contract performance)
  • Management:
    • Negotiation management with regulatory bodies, institutes and business partners
    • Identification of key strategic risks and opportunities that could materially impact the operation and implementation of appropriate processes and systems to mitigate/leverage them
    • Operation in and across different commodity, geographical and socio-political contexts
    • Local language skills and appreciation of local culture
    • Data analysis and management for decision-making
    • Delivery of safe operational performance over 1-2 year time horizon
  • Compliance:
    • Establishment of a culture within discipline in which safety and health is paramount and that results in zero fatalities

Additional Information

Who We Are

We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity and showing care and respect for people and the planet? That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies.

As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

What We Offer

When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfill their potential.

Anglo American Platinum has a zero tolerance to dignity harms, these include all acts of gender based violence, bullying, harassment and victimisation. Ensuring the safety of our employees extends beyond physical safety and includes the eradication of harmful behaviours from our workplace. This responsibility extends to everyone at Anglo American Platinum both during work hours and outside of work. We are unconditional in creating a respectful, inclusive, and safe working environment to ensure that no colleague will be violated or harassed under our watch.

How to Apply

This role is open to Anglo American employees only. To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

Closing Date: 09 April 2024

title: Programa de Prácticas Profesionales para Técnicos 2024
description:
Descripción de la empresa

Anglo American, en sociedad con la Corporación Mitsubishi, está desarrollando la operación minera Quellaveco, uno de los yacimientos de cobre más grandes del mundo, localizado en la región de Moquegua, al sur del Perú.

Quellaveco tendrá una vida de reservas de 30 años. Utilizará proceso minero de tajo abierto y flotación para producir concentrados de cobre, así como molibdeno y plata como subproductos. Se espera que Quellaveco produzca en promedio 300 mil toneladas de cobre por año en sus primeros 10 años de operación.

En Anglo American nuestra estrategia es asegurar y desarrollar Quellaveco aplicando prácticas y tecnologías innovadoras que confiamos a nuestra gente.  Estamos comprometidos a convertirnos en socios para el futuro, operar con seguridad, sustentabilidad y responsabilidad.

    Descripción del empleo

    El programa de prácticas MI Quellaveco (Mining Internship), busca vincular a los egresados de carreras técnicas de institutos superiores con la realidad de su entorno laboral de manera que les permita consolidar su formación académica, maximizar su potencial y ampliar sus oportunidades de inserción en la industria en general.

    El programa tendrá la duración de 6 meses.

    Requisitos

    REQUISITOS:

    Egresados del periodo 2021 al 2023 - II

    De preferencia no haber realizado prácticas profesionales anteriormente

    Disponibilidad para realizar prácticas en Moquegua

    Formación en las siguientes especialidades:

    • Administración
    • Computación e Informática
    • Construcción Civil
    • Diseño y Desarrollo de Software
    • Electricidad
    • Electrónica
    • Electrotécnia Industrial
    • Enfermería Técnica

title: Heavy Equipment Technician
description:
Company Description

Your opportunity for a brilliant career

You communicate openly and enjoy being part of a fantastic team with an unwavering commitment to safety. Come and join us working at Gahcho Kué, one of the world’s greatest mines.

We’re the world’s leading diamond company – a unique luxury business that thrives on the creativity, passion and knowledge of our people.

To push our company forwards, we always need to think differently. We welcome diverse perspectives, people who think rigorously and aren't afraid to challenge assumptions.

In return, we provide you with the space and support to grow and achieve your ambitions.

Job Description

When you join De Beers Group you can expect a competitive salary and benefits package.  But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment with opportunities for learning and growth as an integral contributor to the success of Gahcho Kué Mine. We have opportunities within the Mobile Maintenance Department at the Gahcho Kué Mine, based in the Northwest Territories for highly motivated Heavy Equipment Technicians.  Reporting to the Mobile Maintenance Supervisor the incumbent will be responsible for the preventative maintenance and major repairs to mobile, auxiliary and stationary mining equipment, while continuously aligning daily functions to reflect the values of De Beers.  The ideal candidate is one who is committed to safe working practices and strives for zero harm.

 Rewards & Benefits:

  • Earn up to a 9% company contribution to your pension plan;
  • Relocation support is available to anyone who wishes to move to the Northwest Territories;
  • Quarterly operational bonus program;
  • MyShare Program;
  • Remote Living Allowance;
  • Travel Allowance to offset the costs of getting to the nearest point of pick up;
  • Immediate participation in our 100% employer-paid extended health and dental benefits program (no waiting period); and
  • The Gahcho Kué Mine camp features a full-service dining room, and individual private bedrooms equipped with satellite cable television, telephones, and WiFi internet. There’s also a full-sized gymnasium, squash courts, and state-of-the-art fitness equipment.

Key responsibilities:

  • Working with a team to conduct job risk assessments and safe work plans ahead of the work being completed and performing work in a safe well-managed manner;
  • Conducting preventative maintenance and servicing of mobile equipment;
  • Checking for proper performance and inspecting equipment to detect faults and malfunctions;
  • Diagnosing, troubleshooting and determining extent of mechanical problems;
  • Rebuilding components and working with manufacturers when necessary;
  • Documenting and returning completed work orders in a timely manner;
  • Communicating with Supervisors and co-workers to coordinate work and provide updates; and
  • Providing input and working collaboratively with Planners and Schedulers to develop work packages.

This position is on a 14 days in/14 days out rotation.

Qualifications

  • Must possess a valid Inter-provincial trade qualification in heavy equipment (a copy of the valid certification must be included in your application);
  • A minimum of 12 months of surface mining field experience repairing and maintaining heavy earthmoving equipment;
  • Ability to communicate, share information and seek input to complete assigned work;
  • Ability to approach work with a continuous product improvement mindset;
  • Solid hydraulic and electrical skills, paired with the ability to read and understand schematics;Proven commitment to Safety, Health and Environmental Standards;
  • Experience maintaining hydraulic shovels and SAP would be considered assets; and
  • Experience working at a remote mining site and in a cross cultural work environment.

Additional Information

Who We Are: De Beers Canada

Active in Canada for over 60 years, we are part of De Beers Group, the world's leading diamond company. Globally, we are a team of more than 20,000 people, with operations in Canada, Botswana, Namibia, and South Africa, and activities across the diamond value chain from exploration to diamond jewelry retail. Our unwavering focus on sustainability and Building Forever fuels our commitment to advance standards across the diamond industry, protect the natural world, partner with local communities, and accelerate economic inclusion to support diversity in our business and beyond.

In Canada, we have more than 600 employees working at offices in Calgary, Toronto and Yellowknife, actively exploring for new diamond opportunities, recovering diamonds at the joint venture Gahcho Kué mine in the Northwest Territories, and closing and rehabilitating two mines. We are also advancing the Chidliak Project to establish a technologically advanced diamond mine on Baffin Island using FutureSmart Mining™ principles.

At De Beers, we believe in the power of working in partnership with communities to create lasting, positive impacts that endure long after we recover the last diamond. Our inclusive and diverse workplace values mining with respect for the environment and nearby communities, and we seek team players who share our passion for Making Life Brilliant.

Safety

Safety first is a way of life for us. We are unconditional about the safety, health and well-being of our colleagues, at work and at home, and about that of the communities where we work. We aim to lead the industry by investing in innovation to protect people, who are at the heart of our business. Our high performing teams take accountability for their own and others' actions, work collaboratively, and always show care and respect.

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion (EDI)

As a global #HeForShe Thematic Champion, De Beers is committed to promoting an equitable, inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are. We provide equality of opportunity to enable everyone to fulfil their potential. Please inform us should there be any special requirements that should be considered as part of your application.

Building Forever

Sustainability is at the heart of our decision-making – it is how we do business.   Building Forever is key to our purpose as it represents our ambitious and holistic sustainability framework and is central to our ability to deliver long-term value to our communities and partners. This shapes how we protect our social and environmental license to operate, build a long-term legacy in our host communities and earn consumers’ trust in our diamonds that they can wear with pride.

Background Checks

Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

Referral

This opportunity is open to a paid referral incentive according to the Employee Referral Program (HRM.AD.21.01). Referral incentives are applicable to De Beers Group internal employees only.
